text: Good sushi,  great happy hour,  50% off all chef special rolls. If I lived on the east side,  I'd definetly frequent here.
Ambiance is great. The video wall is amazing!

I've been to a lot of sushi places spots and this one is awesome! Very high quality, good prices and nice, clean atmosphere. Friendly attentive staff. 1/2 rolls still but I caught the all you can eat lunch for only $19.99. Great selection of nigiri and the rolls are amazing not stuffed full or rice. Highly recommend
Went to ayce almost everywhere in the valley. This new guy Justin my Hawaiian brother made my rolls superb. I'll be back. If u ever do eat here. Ask for Jay or justin. He's the man.

Excellent food, excellent fish, and the people who work there are all very nice. The fish is great almost always. great albacore nigiri. Spicy tuna is good but a little too spicy for me. 
Atmosphere is not very romantic or anything but its a great place to grab some good fish with a friend.

Just moved to the east side of the strip and was looking for a new sushi spot. I came across Daisho one evening. My girlfriend and I stopped in for happy hour. What a great choice. The happy hour is very reasonable and selection is great. Fish was fresh and tastes were amazing. Definitely will be back regularly. Service was a little lacking that's why the 4 stars but the tastes and flavors make up for everything
I love sushi and this place meet my expectations, I recommend trying it.  the employees are friendly.
My favorite sushi bar to sit at. Great food and conversation. I come here 3 times a week

Need to go back here. Order this when you go : Paradise Roll (coconut shrimp), garlic edamame, chicken yakitori (coulda been cooked a little bit more well done for my liking) , Age Tofu, house salad with Ginger dressing,

I went here yesterday for an AYCE lunch for the first time.  The server did not smile from the time I entered, throughout the meal and even when I walked out.  Whenever she gave me a plate or took one away I would always thank her but after getting no response and a blank face, I stopped thanking her. I ordered nigiri ( 2 orders of tako, spicy crab, spicy tuna, garlic tuna, and tai). The first order of tako nigiri came with a small thin slice of lemon and the second order did not come with lemon. So a little inconsistent there but other than that everything was good. Items that are only available for dinner should be clearly noted on the menu. The server said everything with an asterisk under the specialty roll is only available for dinner.  There are way more items throughout the menu that have an asterisk before it so I was kind of confused and had to double check that the poke is included with the AYCE lunch. For appetizers I had the yellowtail poke, enoki bacon yakitori and shrimp bomb. The poke was good but I prefer mine without seaweed. I did not like the shrimp bomb. The shrimp yakisoba was ok. If I see different servers before I go in, I may eat here again.

This place is the closest sushi restaurant to me so my boyfriend and I wanted to try it. We had people telling us they liked this place so we went a few nights ago and first we waited about 20 minutes to get seated when the table was ready the whole time then another 10 minutes to wait for someone to ask our drink order until and didn't come back for another 10 minutes.. at this point we were both hungry and couldn't wait for who knows how long for someone to ask if we wanted food.. we ended up leaving and they didn't seem to care that a customer was walking out. Some of the worst service I have ever received in a long time.
The food is amazing and so are the Mochi Ice Cream is amazing, I recommend the Strawberry! The Fantasy Roll is really good!

We came here to celebrate my nephew's birthday.  The all you can eat is worth it for those who will eat the pricier dishes. I  had the black cod bento and it was delicious. If you bring a big party (more than 6 people), you will be charged 18% tip automatically.

We have been going to Daisho for about two years now.
We needed to find a new go to as our old one had closed.

Every time we eat here, it's perfect.  The greeter is quick and pleasant, we like to sit in the booths, it's nice they have the option of booth or table.  We usally have the same server, so it's nice to see familiar faces when we go.  They take your order, and then bring out the dishes.  We've never had a long wait, service and like water refills have been on point.  

The food is fantastic!  Our go to items are the garlic tuna, wild fire, Johnny roll, and the green muscles. The all you can eat is around $25, plus you get a punch card after 10 ayce, you get one free, I think we are on our 3rd card :)

Everything we've gotten here has been fresh, and very tasty.  Highly recommend Daisho for a nice night out, or just a casual lunch.

Half off sushi happy hour, and if you buy $30 worth, you get a free cocktail! Good deal right? The girl we had as our server was a gem, so sweet! But a guy that came by made me feel ashamed for taking advantage of the deal. I ordered enough for leftovers the next day (and yes, I know sushi is only good for a short amount of time), but he said he thought I ordered too much and encouraged my friends to eat some of my food. I'm the type of person that feels bad saying anything negative about anyone (I even feel bad about rating them down 1 star) but my friends even thought he was a little out of line. The sushi was delicious though! I'll enjoy my leftovers tomorrow.

I came in for take out so I can't really comment on the service or any other menu items.  I can however comment on the sushi.  The prices are great, at the time of this review they were running a 50% off all sushi.  "You get what you pay for" is certainly how I felt after my first visit, which in this case what not a whole lot.  The sushi rice was not properly cooked, mushy on the outside, crunchy on the inside.  The rolls are thin, not rolled tight and lacked any of the usual cucumber/avocado or toppings/sauces.  The tempura was definitely NOT made to order, hence not crunchy but rather stale, the California roll had nothing but imitation crab, again no cucumber etc.   I was rather excited to see this place as it is conveniently located on my way home from work. Sadly, I will not return.

I love this place! It's down-to-Earth, not fancy, and the food is good... all of this combined means cheaply priced, delicious sushi! I originally came here because I have a Groupon... I still have that Groupon because the waitress was kind enough to point out that the Groupon doesn't expire until January and they had 1/2 priced regular rolls as a Grand Opening special. I am a fan of the "simpler" sushi rolls anyway, so this was like finding a gold mine, and I have been going back ever since. Their sushi is already so reasonably priced (without the 1/2 off) compared to the rest of Vegas that this means their Grand Opening special (which was still going as of 11/16/13) resulted in $2-3 regular rolls. 

The rolls are pretty standard and the ingredients are fresh. Considering I'm on a fixed income and a sushi addict, I couldn't ask for more from a sushi place!

Food: Excellent food and an excellent selection.
Rating: Five stars

Service: The service was good once the server showed up.
Rating: Three stars

Atmosphere: The decor is nice and the restaurant is comfortable.
Rating: Four stars

Location: The strip mall location and parking are very convenient.
Rating: Five stars

Great Time, Great Food, Great Service. I'm not one to write reviews but I had to for these guys. Had the all you can eat and was not dissapointed. Everything was spot on and the Chef behind the bar asked my girl and I if we like x, x, and x to which he then created something from those items. Get the Bacon Wrapped Mushrooms or Quail Eggs for sure. My Iced Tea was never below Half. And even though we were getting close to closing time they never mentioned or made us feel rushed to leave. Very good experience.

It's only been open over a week and I've been here over 5x already really good and the staff is friendly... Sushi is fresh and doesn't take to long to get In front of you also everything taste great highly recommend coming here.

I came here once because it was nearby and I fell in love. Been back at least 4 times now within the 2 week time span... And I will continue to return. Their sushi chefs and servers are fast and friendly, their rolls are delicious, and their price is affordable. Enjoy!

Our favorite sushi place closed so been looking for a replacement. Daisho did not disappoint. Very friendly staff. Service was very prompt. Did AYCE, very extensive menu. Fish was very fresh. Favorites were spicy girl, salmon love, what's wrong rolls. Sashimi also on AYCE menu and the white tuna and salmon were awesome. They do half rolls, which let us try many different rolls. Long list of appetizers available including black cod and pork belly. Everything was great!! Wish I could have eaten more
Daisho is a great place. Very good sushi, I always get the All You Can Eat deal.

This was my first visit - I can assure you it won't be my last!   If you live in the area and haven't tried Daisho, you must.  Amazing service, delicious and innovative rolls, clean and the police eat here!  You know automatically that it is good with them here!  I really like the fact that they have several options of tolls that do not have rice!! I try to limit my white rice I take and can easily do that here!  Even the rolls that had rice, the rice was NOT overwhelming!  Friendly chefs, less or no rice, and Super affordable!!! Thank you Daisho for helping to make my Mothers Day a happy one!

Well priced, high quality food with a great customer-oriented experience. You can't beat their happy hour. I met some sushi neighbors who introduced me to Sake. Woo! Seriously though, they ship in fresh quality seafood and it shows, you can taste it.

Amazing and friendly !!our service is always top notch. We used to dine at Sushi-Mon every time , that was until the first time we came here and haven't looked back since!! This is the spot to try!! Don't let the last 3 terrible businesses located here change your mind!! This place is remodeled and completely cleaned up!! Fresh fresh fresh , what else do you want at a sushi bar!!

After the last 2 to go orders the quality was very low. I'm not sure if I had a string of bad luck but this recent order alone; the salmon nigiri was fishy, the California rolls were oddly very sweet, the spicy yellowfin was the blandest sushi I've ever tasted, it wasn't spicy either. Because their prices are low they get an extra star. I'm sad because I really liked them at first.  :-(

We came here for lunch, our "first time experience". The room is nice the chairs were comfortable.

I had the special roll combo.
The rolls that I selected were pretty tasty and the size of the rolls were perfect, not to large and not loaded with rice. The special came with "salad" and miso soup. The salad was not salad at all. It was a ramekin of shredded cabbage with a small drizzle of dressing. I found the miso soup to be weak.

My wife had the salmon tempura combo. The salmon and tempura were tasty but it came with a similar "salad" as my combo. We both ordered hot tea. This tea was so weak we wondered if the bag had been reused and we were surprised to find a $2 charge for it on the receipt. 

The overall value was fair for what we received. There certainly was no home run hit here and we left smelling like deep fryer oil. If you have another sushi spot, stick with it.

This place is great for a late night meal with the happy hour after 9pm. They always welcome and thank us. I like how it's not too busy at night so the rolls come out pretty fast. Gone here many times and have had no problems. Their prices are very reasonable too.

I don't know if the special they have is all day but I've been here twice for lunch and basic cut and hand rolls are half off! Which means I got three rolls (most were about 6 pieces each) for less than $10. They were simpler, like spicy ahi and tiger. Service wasn't that great second time I went, but will be back for cheap, quick eats.
Good food... but even better prices! That was the main reason why I decided to check this place. We went after 9:00pm to get the happy hour specials and it was def. worth it!
Food was good, but service was bad! No attention at all. I won't be back to eat at restrant, but will be back to take their food out.

I just tried the sharks tale.....and its probably the best thing I have had here. Prices are very decent the service is awesome.  The people here will check on how your doing and don't wait until your done with your meal before coming back again. Overall, this place is very clean and I would recommend it for anyone.

Best all you can eat menu around this part of town!
My go-to's are the Starfish,  Wild Fire and the Snow White. 
Great happy hour deals as well if you're only looking for a snack or small meal.  
The AYCE prices are in line with everyone else's and the selection is great.

Update on my previous pre grand opening review. 
This time we tried the bluefin tuna, wow! I see why Japan pays so much for bluefin simply the best. Amaebi was the largest size I've ever had. No rice rolls were yummy & very well presented. Oysters were very fresh, & my favorite black cod was again to die for. Service was excellent.
This has moved past Yama as my favorite sushi spot.

Not my normal spot but stopped in on the way home from a fairly crappy day. The price was on point for the all you can eat. I sat at the bar and the conversation was hilarious between staff and other patrons. 

I do kind of wish the host backed off a little bit. I would finish the last piece on a plate an she was Jonny on the spot taking it away. 
One big bonus. Tako available!

Daisho staff were very pleasant and courteous. Kindly answered questions and kept our table very clean. 

Went during lunch time and although there were several other parties, it wasn't too crowded on this Friday afternoon. 

We went with the all you can eat menu which was $21.95 plus tax per person. Very reasonable considering how much sushi usually costs.  There are some items on the menu which can only be ordered during the dinner hours which costs a little bit more ($25.95), but there were only a few of those items...

The service was quick and you can order as much as you want for a 60 minute duration. But don't over order as you will be charged extra for anything that is left that you aren't able to finish.  You are also able to order other items while you are eating so we just ordered as we are which worked out well.

Not only all that, but the sushi was very good.  Tasty and well cooked.

They also have dessert on the menu which you are able to order once you are done with the sushi.

Would definitely eat here again!!
Sushi was bomb! My first time in today, will definitely be back.  It's very clean and staff is awesome and friendly

Been to this place a few times now,  the food's always great!  Love the Triple Bang!  Highly recommended! This last time I went,  I noticed they had updated some technology inside.  The video wall is awesome! Definitely makes this place unique! And the big fish at the entrance looks so alive.  Definitely recommend this place for date night to express the girl or just hanging out with friend! Best sushi environment I've been to.

Myself and the fiance have been looking for some decent sushi in Henderson but have not found anything that really caught our eye.  We happened to notice Daisho just driving down the street and decided to give it a try at around 10pm.

There were a few customers at the bar, but otherwise the place was empty...and that surprised me.  We were glad to hear that there was a late night happy hour on both food and drinks.   We ordered a few different rolls (California crunch, spicy tuna),bacon yaki-tori, soup, edemame, saki, and some beers.  Everything tasted perfect.

Everything came out promptly and the waitress answered all of our questions politely.  The price was phenomenal, especially for the sheer amount of food that we ordered and the quality.  This will definitely be somewhere we frequent as we live just down the street and are always looking for some decent sushi later on without going on a long drive.

WORST SERVICE EVER! I came here with my husband for dinner. We go to sushi places all over town, and decided to try this place. The waitress approached our table & we ordered 3 sushi rolls and a bottle of wine, a moment later the manager walked up to our table & told us we should order the all you can eat sushi instead, he said we would be getting more for our money, so we took his advice and ordered two all you can eat for $24.95 each. Never were we told we had to eat every last bite of sushi on our plate or they would charge us and additional $10 leftover fee. We have eaten all you can eat sushi at least at a dozen other sushi diners and NEVER did they charge us a fee for not eating everything. The manager came up to our table yelling at us (while using profanity) when we said that we should not have to pay the $10 fee because there was no signs anywhere saying you had to eat everything on your plate or there would be a $10 charge (he said it was sushi law lol). I told him typically when I order all you can eat sushi they offer half rolls so you don't have much leftovers. Regardless, even when we had leftovers never did any place charge us for it. DO NOT EAT HERE. There are so many good sushi places in Las Vegas & Henderson, Daisho Sushi is very bland at best, but whats worse than the poor quality of sushi is the horrendous service this place has. I have never had a employee, much less a manager treat me so disrespectful, he didn't care there were other people trying to eat and children were present while he used profanity. This place I imagine will be closed down soon because of the tremendously poor service, plus they do anything they can to rip off their customers.

Had ayce lunch ($19.95ea) for two here on a Sunday noon and was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant didn't have very many patrons at the time we came in, maybe five or six other tables aside from us so service was super fast.  Our food was being delivered almost faster than we can eat them, old plates being taken away just as quick, and our beverages never less than half full.  The facility was also sparkly clean as what you can expect from a brand new spot.

We were able to sample the majority of their nigiri and found them to be very good overall.  The fish were as fresh and had a good rice to fish ratio.  They do seem to make the nigiri a bit smaller than average, which I appreciate since this gives you the opportunity to sample other items on the menu and not get full too quickly.  I also feel that you can get a better taste of the food if you're mouth is less stuffed per bite.

We also sampled a good number of their yakitori and totally loved each one.  This is probably what sets them apart from other ayce joints.  Sure you can find yakitori elsewhere but their bacon-wrapped yakitori items here is exceptional, one of the most flavorful I've had in recent memory.  We also had both the salmon and yellowtail poke and thought that they were good too, though nothing compared to poke from poke express.

While there are plenty of ayce sushi places in the valley, there are only a handful that are really worth going back again and again.  I'll have to go back here again to be sure and to evaluate their consistency but Daisho sushi looks like a keeper to me.  I would rank this place in the same class and category as Yama and Goyemon in overall food flavor and dining satisfaction.  The best part of it is that Daisho is slightly cheaper in that lunch is only $19.95 and dinner $24.95, where the competition charges 1-2 bucks more.

Sushi - Mediocre
Ordered a piece of fish and they gave us one with a THICK piece of sinew, tried but can't chew at all.

Rolls - Got their 2 most expensive rolls, they did not WOW us.

Service - Very good, guy came over and exchanged the sinew dish immediately

Over charging - Made mistake on the bill and over charge us, good thing we checked and they fixed it.

We wanted to like this place but 2 major mistake in a roll, it's tough to do.
Good place if you're hungry, craving sushi & not wanting to spend a whole lot of money  $2.50 for 8 rolls is amazingggg as a sushi lover

food is bomb here! nigiri specially!! been looking for a decent place to go get sushi in henderson....finally found it!!! fish is fresh!! im super picky when it comes to sushi but this place did it. sit by the bar and the chefs will help you out!

My boyfriend and I live very close to Daisho so it has become a late night staple for us. Their happy hour is such a good deal, especially because they do late night also. Their chefs special rolls are 50% off so we can easily justify ordering 5-6 of them. The staff has always been friendly and attentive. Plus they have Hana flavored sake!!! Daisho is a great local sushi joint with good deals and an inviting atmosphere - I definitely recommend it.
it was ok service was slow and the baked japanese lasagna is not what i expected. the waitress forgot some of our order.

Great customer services, every single roll I tasted were really good and I have to mention they are really fast, so if you are hungry,  this is the place you wanna go. 
A+

SNAP YAMA SUSHI HAS SOME COMPETITION! Still so new but here is our ratings and why...1-5 1 being caca and 5 being AWESOME! 

Service - 5
Location - 5 but we live close
Price - 5 totally worth it and all you can eat is reasonable/competitive 
Food - 5 and again try everything including chef special
Facilities - CLEAN 5!!!
And happy hour includes chef special rolls 50% 3-6pm and 9-11pm! 

Yummo must try!!!!

Great All you can eat deal with a very extensive sushi menu. It was seriously one of the most underrated places I've ever been. It was empty on a Friday night as well so service was quick and attentive. Fish was fresh. Can't wait to come back and eat here!!

It has been a really LONG time since i've been really wowed by sushi. I came to a point in my life where I really questioned whether or not sushi, in general, has become perpetually trite. After visiting Daisho, my opinion of sushi has changed. This is now my favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas, and what they are doing here is surprisingly wonderful. Here's why:

First, after walking in the door and being seated by the server at the bar, we were given our menu's. They had the expected items you would see on any sushi menu, but after looking at the appetizer menu, you can tell that these guys are trying to do things distinctive. We had the AYCE menu for 25 bucks, and Tony T. and I started our voyage through this unique menu.

Note: We tried a great volume of items, so I would probably max out the 5000 character limit on Yelp reviews by describing only 1/4 of what we had. There was zilch that I didn't like on menu, but there some dishes that are especially noteworthy.

: Salmon Collar/Yellowtail Collar - This was unbelievable. I was totally blown away, especially by the salmon. The first time I had collar of a fish was at Yonaka, and it was wonderful. On the other hand, the collar at Daisho completely blows Yonaka's out of the water!!! Wonderfully tender, with the natural fat sustaining the moistness of the fish, personally (especially with the salmon), I thought I was eating foie gras. It was prepared with an expert hand, and cooked with precision.  It absolutely melted in the mouth. I'm still thinking about it.

: Uni and Ikura (salmon roe) nigiri - Freshest and highest quality uni and salmon roe i've ever had, EVER. The uni had a delicate, but firm texture, and had a clean taste. The same goes for Ikura as well. 

I FINALLY found a place that makes sushi rice correctly!!!! A great deal of people think that it's effortless to create great sushi rice. What folks don't realize is, that in world-class sushi restaurants, sushi apprentices and beginner trainees spend 3-4  (or more) YEARS learning just how to make rice, before they are given the permission to touch a piece of fish. Making sushi rice in itself, is an art form. And these guys nailed it.

A small footnote: This locale is great for low-carbers. There are more than 5 rice less rolls and plenty of apps that do not contain starch or rice, including collar, poke, oysters, yaki-tori and more!!
Salad is good but vegetables not fresh  . Friendly service. All you can eat good . And there have happy hour half price sushi too.

This has to be one of the best sushi places in town. If you haven't been in here you have to go in and see for yourself. They make sushi art work. You don't even want to eat it. 100% you got me coming back. Can't wait till next time. Justin was so sweet and attentive....
AYCE food service was slow and disappointing. An additional star for our kind server.

This. Is. My. Sushi. Spot. I love it so much, it's al you can eat, and it comes out super fresh.  I understand sushi should be fresh, but there's a texture thing and most AYCE places always tastes like it's straight out of the freezer, this place gives you amazing portions and always tastes fresh.  Their rolls are unique and so delicious, and you can always order a half portion so you don't waste any food.  The servers are very sweet and always on top of everything.  I have two boys and they make sure that they have food for them right away, which is so appreciated when you have kids.  The price is fair and they never pressure you eat fast.  I always leave here full and happy.

1st timer and i definitely was impressed. Blue fin is my go to sushi spot but this place is a great runner up. The Avatar roll is a must try. The service and food was really good. This is a place i would come again. Thank you!

Customer service is great and the food is awesome
We have made this our regular sushi place

THIS PLACE STILL SUCKS. 

By far the worst sushi experience I have ever had. It took over 20 minutes to get the first round.

Wasn't sure about this place from parking lot...BUT was starving.

I was pleasantly surprised!! All very fresh and the ALL YOU CAN EAT option is total $$$saver.  This deal included their specials so that was a significant bonus.  

Service was prompt.

Dishes artfully prepared and equally delicious.  

BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!

Very close to car rental return at Las Vegas airport...so, don't waste your money on the bad airport food.  

You'll be pleased with this place.

Keep forgetting to write a review for this place!!

Anyways, all I can say is that this place has top notch Japanese appetizers!! Was really glad they were part of the all-you-can eat menu. The fish they used for the nigiri was actually not that fresh.. especially the tuna.. it looked, funny. The size of the nigiri is also quite small compared to the other places around the valley but it didn't really bother me since I take small bites anyways. Service was excellent. The only problem was when we ordered the salmon collar. It was actually undercooked but they immediately replaced it with a new one so good service on that part. I probably wouldn't come back for all-you-can eat but it is definitely a place to take non-sushi lovers + sushi lovers since they have a larger variety of non-fish appetizers.

Appetizers to get: 

-Miso black cod
-Salmon collar
- Yellowtail collar
- Yakitori
- Fresh oysters

First off let me say that this business is notorious for sending hate mail when the reviewer/customer does not rate this place highly.  Now let me save you the trouble by saying that I will not read hate mail so don't bother as I am sure you will also not bother in making any necessary changes for ALL patrons to be fully satisfied when dining here.  

We came here on a Saturday evening and it was completely dead which was the first red flag.  We had heard good things by a few peeps so we decided to give it a go.  

We started with a few skewers and a kama  or I should say half of a kama which were all crowded all on the same plate thrown over a bed of cabbage accompanied by an overpowering smelly orange slice. AWEFUL! 

Everything we ordered looked nothing like the pictures we saw on yelp. No wonder they frown on picture taking.

So disappointed that I stopped at the second order and could not go on.  It gets worse ...the "sushi chef" also kept shaking his head NO on certain items suggesting they were not of good quality. I noticed that my husband kept ordering other items as if trying to convince himself that it couldn't get worse...but that's all they serve here and he soon realized they just could not be saved.  They also do not offer half rolls and offer 1 dessert per person and with too many restrictions at an all you can eat joint makes for a very un-fun experience all together. 

There is just way too much competition out there and you unfortunately only have in many cases one attempt to cause a good first impression with me.
GOOD LUCK!!
the manger is a very nice guy! All the sushi is so fresh! The best sushi in local place

Have eaten here both for AYCE lynch as well as AYCE dinner. Food was good. Some different unique items on their menu compared to the typical items. Quail egg wrapped with bacon tastes just like breakfast. Yum. Bacon wrapped Mushroom & bacon wrapped asparagus very good. Loved all the riceless rolls unfortunately they are only available fir dinner time.

The location is great! The story behind the chef is inspiring and I'm glad to support a local business owner. 
We had dinner tonight and the service was incredible and the staff were very friendly. 
The food was good. The Daisho Fried Rice was a big hit at our table and I highly recommend it. The portion size was enough for the three of us go share, along with other entrees. I will be going NA k to try some sushi rolls next time around.

Looked for a place close to Sunset Park after a long evening of pokemon hunting, found Daisho right down the road. Our first hint should have been how empty it was during dinner time. Ordered one of the crunchy rolls and it seriously tasted like stale dirty breadcrumbs. The fish did not taste fresh and the rice had a weird texture. The staff was very friendly, no complaints there. but will not come back due to the food. The only thing I liked were the mussels. Oh and the mochi was so cold and hard it made my gums bleed biting into it. I'll stick with Kaizen as my go to AYCE.
Love love love this place. Fantastic food, staff is friendly and prices aren't bad. Great place for sushi.

HORRIBLE. They will cut you off early of your "All You Can Eat" (you will notice obviously when they do) they have to be doing it on purpose to save money its hilarious but i never cared because i would get my full order in ASAP as i realized the "cut off" pattern. I've spent good money at this place because i enjoyed their food but that was also questionable when your puking the next day after a visit and the service is a 50/50 success rate. Tonight was my last visit officially as they had terrible service once again and i had a party of 8 ppl, not only bad service but THEY DID NOT even honor a friend and my own all you can eat dinner cards on SEPARATE checks. The stamp card reads you have to eat 10x All u can eat for 1 Free, Dinner being $27-$28 basically meaning we spent $560 roughly to earn the 2 ($56) free. They only honored one actually AND STOLE OUR SECOND CARD (who creates a whole new punch card and tries to lie about it??) with 6 stamps on it already and gave me one back with 3 when they should have filled the 6/10 stamp card with 4 more stamps as we had 7 "ALL YOU CAN EAT CUSTOMERS" tonight and added 3 extra stamps to a new/next card. I did not know it was this hard to do math for these people but thats obvious too since it took 1 hour NO EXAGGERATIONS to figure out our separate checks with our cards. I love great service and tip VERY WELL brought a big party of friends from out of town and didn't expect such a terrible experience, just to argue over a petty all you can eat for free card. These ppl are cheapskates and i would suggest all future customers to not to waste your time with this place, but u never know might catch them on a non-cheapskate day.

Hands down the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas. My husband and I have tried multiple other sushi places but this is still our favorite to this day.
Food is always fresh, service is great and they remember their returning customers!

I actually love the differences that there sushi rolls taste. I just have one issue when I ask for a roll with soft shelled crab, I am expecting soft shelled crab and not imitation crab meat. I was told it was they way the person mixes the soft shelled crab. This is the first time here I have had to experience soft shelled crab in the texture of imitation crab meat. This is the second place that has had me question wether the soft shelled crab was actually that. I tore the sushi roll (burning night- mixed green onion, masago, onion, spicy tuna, albacore, jalapeño on top, garlic sauce)  apart and it taste and texture was imitation crab meat.
Now they all taste great just wanted the texture that I was looking for in the soft shelled crab. Also the price during happy hour is very reasonable. 
*Shark's Tale - Lobster, Salmon, Snow crab tempura, avocado with eel sauce
*Las Vegas Roll (no rice) - Yellowtail tempura, Kaiware, Crab meat, Masago/cucumber layer, Spicy yum sauce
*Burning night- Mixed green onion, Masago, Onion, Spicy tuna, Albacore, Jalapeño on top, Garlic sauce

Daisho sushi is on the corner of warm springs and eastern so it's perfect for me just about 5 minutes away. Their food is made fresh when ordered and comes out quick and hot, or cold - whichever you ordered. I personally enjoy the John roll, that's my favorite but the rainbow is excellent as well.
Average sushi. The yellowtail and salmon collar was the 2 highlights of the dinner. Not worth the trip back.

I was dying to try something local and was happy to find this place!  Its your basic casual, no frills type of place. 

- Chicken Yakitori. It's OK. ~$4 for 2 pieces (which is standard) - but I could go without it next time.
+ Rolls are 50% off during happy hour - score! Most of them are cooked.. I tried the Snow White and Sharks Tale. The Sharks Tale has a bit of wasabi mixed in with the Salmon and Snow Crab but it's bearable. I never have wasabi and was able to eat this with no problems.. The Snow White is one of the rolls that isn't cooked. As much as I prefer something raw vs. cooked - I'd have to say the Sharks Tale was the best of these two rolls. 
+ Hot green tea. Roughly $2 (I think it's like $1.75 or something). It comes in a tea pot which is great so you don't have to keep asking for refills. It comes in a tea bag. 

If you're staying at the Doubletree this is a good nearby option. I could be within walking distance - just depends if you want to walk 1.5 miles one way or not. I'd rather Lyft =)

i have to say Worth a try~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
nice restaurant ! During our trip to vegas we were looking for a good sushi restaurant which didn't cost a small fortune, and that's exactly what this restaurant is. The space is tiny, so we were lucky to wait just a few minutes. We ordered the sushi and sashimi combination, which were great, but don't miss the yellow tail. It's something to be remembered !I have eaten at a number of sushi joints in my time and I must say that the sushi is not the best but is good quality for this price even better! I am not crazy about the size or decor of the place. I was skeptical at first, but my friend and I both went into it like virgins. We were amazed at the quality of the sushi.

Another great experience! The service was much quicker this time and all of our sushi rolls came out together much sooner than last time. :-) My new favorite is the yum yum scallop crunch roll and my husband's is the lobster roll. The Cajun albacore was much more balanced than the garlic albacore. The eel and spicy tuna and spicy tuna crunch rolls were also delicious! Yea, we didn't realize we ordered two similar rolls until we got our food :3 but it was still tasty. It seemed pretty busy tonight too so I'm glad that they seem to be doing well. Love this place!

Would give 0 stars if an option.  Really tried to like this place as its close to my home and prices seem reasonable.   Unfortunately the service is by far the worst I've ever experienced.   The waiters/waitress definitely make it very clear that placing an order is a huge inconvenience to them (I'm sorry but isn't that their job?).  It felt like pulling teeth to get anyones attention.  I was able to try 2 rolls which were good, wanted to try another but after waiting a long time to get anyones attention I decided I was done spending any more money at this place.  I was with a friend who decided to order more food and kept thanking the waiter but everytime she did he kept rolling his eyes and throwing her orders down on the table...never once smiled or acknowledged her thanks.  If this business wants to succeed in their current location I suggest getting new staff.  I for one will not return to this establishment and will be surprised if they are still in operation in a few months, no one should pay for terrible service.

This place is hit, or miss. We used to go there  every two weeks. Usually the food is really good, but sometimes the rice is dry. Last time the rice was not good. Even the sushi chef admitted that! Good prices for all you can eat. The servers are not so good. So be aware of that. The music is HORRIBLE! Dry rice, horrible music, so so service. We will still go back but not so often like we used to since our favorite sushi chef ; Nacho, left!

I would say it was okay, my wife said not so much. No thrills AYCE they were counting money at a table in the dining area which I thought was very unprofessional. That's just asking for trouble. At one point the money was just on the table and not even being counted. Weird

I pass by this area all the time and I've never seen this place! I found it on yelp so we decided to drive from the east side to try this place. It was date night, hubby and I wanted to try a new spot. This place is clean and the employees were extremely friendly with quick service! The hot house saki 2 for 1 during happy hour was awesome!! We were not disappointed with any of the rolls we ordered. Spicy girl was our favorite!! Loved the music they had playing, had me dancing in my chair as I ate. Lol. For a Saturday it was empty so I'm definitely going to be recommending  this place to my friends!

Looking for a hole in the wall place to get some good sushi, this is the place. I highly recommend the Johny roll. All you can eat is 26$ and a great deal if you're super hungry but if not the regular menu is pretty cheap. Only thing is the sushi pieces are very small

too much rice for every nigiri.

fatty albacore is so smelly because already changed color. 

but service was good.

never wanna be back.

the food is amazing..I don't know what should I write..maybe 2 words is enough.
amazing,unbelievable.this is the best Japanese restaurant.u try it u love it!

This place is beyond amazing! We highly recommend it to anyone and everyone  we came here for our first date and it's been two years and it's still amazing. A great menu for all you can it. It literally has everything on it

placed an order through doordash and received the worst meal in my experience.
I order 6 handroll and all of them were poorly rolled and had literally 2-3 small bites. and I was charged about $55.
i dont mind paying the price for quality food but this food was just ridiculous, they should be ashamed about the products they give to customers.

I went on my birthday and was thrilled to be a customer!  They had some delicacies that I NEVER see at other bars in Las Vegas.  I had some sushi that I had not had since I left Chicago 20 years ago!!!  Awesome!!!  The food was beautifully presented (and I Do not take pictures of my meals), the portions were more than generous and the entire staff was top-notch.  A wonderful find, and I can't wait to go back!
This place was OK,not great. I'm not a big sushi person but I've had tastier dinners at other sushi places. Too much rice,not enough of the good stuff. Frozen Shumai dumplings. Won't return.
Love their half off regular rolls during the week! Their service is also really good. I eat there at least twice a month for lunch!

Went here Sunday @ around 4 pm with a total company of 4. Did the AYCE and started with 

salmon poke -- it is mixed with seaweed salad. this i would rate 2/5, taste was ok but too much seaweed salad mixed with it. 

uni -- it was good, 3/5.

amaebi (sweet shrimp) - 3/5.

lobster roll - 3/5, i did not taste lobster in it and the wasabi mixed in it overpowered it.

also ordered a couple of regular rolls like the scallop and salmon yum yum, 3/5-- all were room temperature which was a little weird. 
what disappointed me was when i ordered 'rock and roll,'

i thought it was mostly sashimi of fish but it was fish inside shave cucumber -- mostly cucumber that'll fill you up moreso than the fish --

i did not expect it to be like that and ate all my fish, the waiter came to me and said "WE WILL CHARGE YOU EXTRA IF YOU DO NOT EAT the cucumber" so I made sure I finished all the cucumber.

i've been to a lot of sushi place and this was the first time this ever happened to me - i would have taken it better if it was said in a polite manner but no, it wasn't. 

Steven, sushi chef- was amazing and tried making up for it (i told him ok, give me sushi that doesn't have a lof of rice in it) and he did-- but because i ate all the cucumber (rock n roll) i was so full of it, i couldn't enjoy any sushi anymore.

there was no manager that day so i finished off and left. I called the next day to let the manager know about what happened and she apologized, Apology accepted but I will never go back to this place -- there are TOO many sushi places in LAS VEGAS and for the quality and price -- I can easily go somewhere else and get an excellent service with the same caliber if not better, sushi. 

in the end, i left super full of cucumber and very much disappointed.
i would most definitely can give it a second try but my experience had me left with a bad taste in my mouth in more occasion than one.

Delicious. We are really picky with sushi and have tried a few not so great ones since we moved to Vegas (we are newer to Vegas from the Bay Area) and were pleasantly surprised about how good their sushi was. All the fish tasted so fresh which is so important! And the restaurant itself is cute. Servers and chefs were friendly. Definitely our new go to sushi place. Not to mention their price point is great.

This place is amazing! The service is super fast and the staff is always friendly and energetic. If you sit at the bar you can just place your order with the sushi chef and he'll make your food immediately. Happy hour is such a good deal on the chefs special rolls! And after happy hour it's buy one get one on regular rolls. The sushi is fresh and tasty and I'm so glad I came upon this place!

Always amazing. Everyone is friendly and helpful. The fish is fresh, flavorful and skillfully prepared. The Starfish and Wildfire are a must!  Their garlic c sauce that they use on the garlic tuna - insane! 
My go to sushi place.

My family and I have been dining at Daisho Sushi for a few years, this is the first time I have rated them. I guess I'm so contend that I forget to give them a rating after my delicious meal. Lol, We enjoyed a great meal, very fresh and this is important when having Japanese food. The services was always superior. If you like dining Japanese, I would recommend it.
I have tried many others but always return back to the best. I live here in Las Vegas, comparing 2 dozen places in hotels and local places, this is the best.

Yay! for new AYCE.... Didn't have time to try Diasho's AYCE but menu offers a nice variety.
Nigiri: there's super white, blue crab, uni, fatty albacore
Appetizers: poki, yakitori, miso black cod, fresh oyster, hamachi kama
Noodles: udon, blue crab fried rice, yakisoba
Dessert: fried banana, banana split 

There's a variety of rolls.
Tried a few regular rolls since its 50% off grand opening special. Enjoyed an inexpensive late lunch. Look forward to trying again soon.
Nice decor, clean, friendly staff, good food.

Last time there were a few service issues, over baked mussels and slightly cold oysters. This time the oysters still weren't as cold as they should have been everything else was excellent! There are even more items on the AYCE menu than my last trip and I really didn't think that was possible. Most of my order was the same as last time but we added the salt and pepper fish (5 stars), blue crab fried rice (5 stars), fried banana desert (9 stars) cheesy corn (3 stars) and poke (1 Star). The poke was literally the smallest portion I've seen in my life cut in the smallest pieces ever. Lol The blue crab fried rice was almost a full dinner portion and was great!!! The damn fried banana desert blew my socks off and I'm not a big banana fan....ha......ha! I cant wait to go back!

OK, so I am reviewing my bank statement making sure everything is ok and I find a suspicious charge that I am unsure of.  Thinking it may be this restaurant I call to ask the manager what the charge would come up as under a banking statement, as often the name of the restaurant is not the name of the company doing business as the restaurant in question.  So the woman who picks up the phone does not only not want to hand the phone over to the manager/owner, but asks who is calling, I say "one of your customers, I am just trying to figure out if the charge I have on my bank statement is correct"  and she says all of a sudden he is not present at all.  I said I would call back and she asks well "why are you calling?  Do you want to order?" I say no I am calling to figure out if a charge is correct, her response; "Well who is charging you? What statements are being made?" I politely tell her she doesn't understand the proper meanings of these words, so I will call back later when the manager/owner is back.  She says: "He wont be back for a few days.... Would you like to order?"  Wow.  I will never come back here again for not only being treated this way when I am trying to be polite and just talk to the manager, but also for the fact that she won't let me talk to the manager, and third for accidentally finding out that this is the type of place where if you need the owner's/manager's help correcting or verifying a transaction that this is the sort of response you would get.  On a side note: the food was ok, I have had better, but since it is literally across the street I would be here every few days.... not anymore.
One of my favorite places. I will sometimes just go by myself to eat, and have a glass of wine. The sushi chefs are so friendly. Definitely recommend.

Seriously the BEST sushi place ever! My brother recommended this place to us while visiting and I'd definitely go back to Vegas just for Daisho Sushi. Quality of the fish is on point. So fresh. The price... For AYCE, it's definitely worth it! The owner is such a cool person and service is great. I literally wanted to try every roll lol. You can order half rolls but it was all too good to order just half. Absolutely love everything!
Me and my bf comes to this Sushi Place once a week. Love the food, friendly staff especially the owner! If you're looking for a good sushi place come to this place good sushi and affordable :)

So good! This place is going to the top of my Vegas Sushi rotation. Awesome rolls, clean and so hospitable. The Paradise, the Sweetheart, the Dragon, the Trick-or-treat, the California Crunch, and Teriyaki Chicken were all amazing!

The sushi here is honestly mediocre. I've eaten all over and this was just average/below average. The half price for two regular rolls was cool but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone honestly. Take your dollars somewhere else if you want good sushi.

I'm not gonna lie I loved this place a lot I loved the avitar roll which I have never had steak on a sushi roll which was dope!! I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. The atmosphere was nice and very comfortable. Please go and give it a try!!

So ok my coworkers told me about this place  and after waiting 20 min for a rainbow roll these fools have the nerve to charge 50 cents for ponzu sauce because it was Togo but if I ate there it's free. Smh rip off

Two weeks ago I was caught on Warm Springs and Eastern during a huge flood/hailstorm.  I pulled off into the Walmart shopping center to wait it out.  I spotted Daisho, and since the storm was showing no signs of letting up, I decided to go in.  I was so happy I did!!!

They had an all you can eat menu for 21.95.  The selection was great.  There was all kinds of appetizers, salads and desserts.  There was also a front and back page of sushi options that were included in the all you can eat price.  The only stipulation is that you must eat what you order, because they will charge you extra for wasted food.

I was alone that day, so I sat at the sushi bar.  I notified the sushi chef that I was pregnant and asked if he could let me know if anything I ordered had raw fish.  He went above and beyond and told me to order whatever I wanted and he would make sure he cooked anything that would have been raw.  Both of the sushi chefs working that day were very friendly and extremely attentive.

I ended up ordering 4 rolls in total. Had a cucumber salad and ordered a fried banana for dessert.  I highly recommend the Daisho roll.  I feel like I definitely got my money's worth.  I have been spreading the word about this great sushi place ever since, and I can't wait to go back!!

More like a 3.5 review. Wanted to try a new sushi restaurant since the one we usually go to is closed Mondays. Soooooo....looked at a couple of places on Yelp and Daisho Sushi was what we decided on on a Monday night.

We came here around 7pm and it wasn't busy at all. There was a total of 6 people at the restaurant...including my bf and I. We never do AYCE sushi....we like ordering a la carte. So spicy tuna roll is what we wanted to start off with. It was pretty good....you can't really fk up that roll. Next we ordered a Godzilla and Spicy Girl. 
Godzilla was supposed to have soft shell crab but we barely got any in there. There were actually more crab meat and avocados than anything else! Spicy Girl was good....a lot of flavors going on with that one. Presentation was nice and they don't skim you on rolls....it was packed with yummy goodness. Specialty rolls ranged from like $10.95-14.95.

Restaurant is on the smaller side so I can imagine you might have to wait for a table during busy/primetime hours. Overall, it was simply A-OK. We MIGHT be back but there are plenty of other sushi places we go to before we decide come back here.

Daisho is the place to be!! Love it ! Food is amazing. The service could improve but if you sit at the bar area the chefs will take care of you. Over all is a great place to eat and eat some delicious sushi!

The sushi is good, the customer service horrible.. We had been there 3 times, Two of the times there were maybe 3 other tables, we had 4 in our party, and one child, it took over 35 minutes for 2 of us to get any rolls.  I enjoy the food and the place is close to my job. But when you're not very busy and you're taking that long, with 3 sushi chefs.. there's something wrong.  Also my friends ordered salads that they didn't get until we reminded the waitress that we had ordered them.  I don't think I will be taking anyone there again.  Maybe if they up the customer service.
Great food and a lot of yummy rolls.. The price is very affordable and the quality is great. I frequent this restaurant often..

I frequent the adjacent market and live around the corner, so I stopped in for a lunch AYCE this week when I noticed the construction was finally over and the "Open" sign lit up -- and had a tremendous meal. I've visited 7 or 8 sushi places since I moved here 2 years ago -- at three of them MANY more than once -- and Daisho has already cracked my Top 2. Also, I have not seen a $19.95 price for AYCE Lunch anywhere else in Vegas - and now a sign in the window today promises 50% off rolls and AYCE for their Grand Opening (I did not get any further details as they were not yet open). Given that I work 11pm shifts, "Lunch" is my late-night feast :-)

Wherever it's offered, I always start out with an Ahi Poke... If for some odd reason I got to a sushi AYCE and suddenly wanted NO variety, I would just order four or five Ahi Pokes. This one had the perfect boldness and sesame backdrop. I had a few nigiri yellowtail, nigiri salmon, and a wrapped roll with avocado and shrimp. Then I realized that this was an un-planned stop and I shouldn't try to eat what I would when I prepare for an AYCE. So I called it a day.

I can't wait to go back. If you live in the area or are just visiting, you should have it at LEAST once.

Get:  

Starfish Roll 
Wild Fire
Shrimp/crab tempura
Blue crab nigiri
Salmon nigiri
Fatty albacore nigiri
Yellowtail/salmon  collar.
Sweet heart

Stay away from:

Uni - it was bitter tasting, definitely, not the creamy, fresh, ocean-y, nutty taste it should be.
Garlic tuna nigri, didn't really have much flavor to it surprisingly.


Unfortunately, their menu was a bit confusing.. marked with a permanent marker, new selections that are now Dinner only.  We came in around 3:50 pm to have lunch, got seated and were told we still have time to do lunch.    Then the server left to get us waters.  By the time he came back, and we were ready to order, he told us "sorry, it's now dinner"  so we had to pay the dinner price =T   It's 'okay' because I wanted to eventually try the dinner menu, and a few things I enjoyed during the lunch ayce, I found were now "dinnner only".    

Most of the service was pretty fast, I think for some reason though the sweet heart roll took longer to make (?) but it was pretty good.

First time Daisho sushi. I love this place 

Good food and good Price. 

I will be buck !!!

A friend recommended this place. My wife and I have been a total of 3 times over the last two months.  It's gotten increasingly worse every time.  We only do the AYCE. The first time was really good. Great selection, food was good,  sushi came out quickly, and the service was prompt.  The second time wasn't as good overall.  Food was still good,  but the service was lacking.  The third time was just atrocious!  The nigiri came out with the biggest balls of rice I've ever seen at any sushi restaurant, topped with the thinnest slice of fish.  It was so hard to eat. I literally had to drink water with the food in my mouth just to get the rice down.  We were waiting so long to get each of the things we ordered.  I brought up our concern to the waitress and asked if she remembered us from last week and she said yes. I told her that this wasn't the same experience we had then and the food was nothing like it was.  I got no response,  she just nodded her head and walked away to where what I assume is the manager and another coworker were standing.  It was obvious she was telling them what I had said.  The entire group thought it was funny. The manager didn't even bother to come talk to us!  The place only had one other table occupied, it's not like they were too busy. This last experience was a bummer because the place can be a really good find.  I recommend gambling on this place. That's exactly what it's been,  a gamble.

Okay I want to like this place and only giving two stars is really hard! The sushi was fresh and nice portions and the wildfire and sweet tomato are my new fave rolls.... But....
The service was below average. Felt uncomfortable there. And it didn't help that the guy, who based on other yelpers picks might be the owner was rude! I ordered a Snow White to him, he took my order then walked away. 10 min later I realized he wasn't coming back and didn't tell other chef about my order so I had to order it again. Our rolls were good but based on other yelpers picks who know him, we got short sticked on our presentation... I like the radish noodles with my sushi! 
Then they don't do half rolls and with all you can eat there are so many limitations. I agree with other yelpers that with all those limitations I can go somewhere else! Only certain appetizers are included in all you can eat, you can only do one each of the rolls with no rice, and because of those rolls I had to pay dinner price at lunch time. 
I really want to like this place as they had good selection and all. But I didn't feel comfy... When chef gave me attitude when I said most places have a tiger roll and it's good I was like what??? And they weren't very nice to my kid who loves sushi and loves sitting at the bar cause most places make it fun for her! So due to all that I gave two for quality of fish and selection but when I go out I want to enjoy myself!
Great service and incredible menu. I lived the Rock n Roll roll. I highly suggest it. The all you can eat is great, but they don't do half rolls.

Wow!  All you can eat sushi for $24.95, and it includes uni, sweet shrimp, toro, blue crab, miso cod, etc.?  

In Vegas for the night, I Yelp'd to find a sushi place nearby and this came up.  Their prices are quite reasonable but when you do the "All You Can Eat" special, you really can't go wrong!  I had all of the above along with octopus, halibut, salmon, yellowtail, seaweed salad, and a few other dishes and along with a beer and large sake, my bill came to $33.  Again, wow!  The quality was excellent!  Michael is the greeter/manager/owner(?), and he was wonderful with his recommendations.

I'm coming back here when I'm in Vegas, and bringing the wife, whom I miss terribly.

I eat here way too much. Royal Kalamazi, pink lady, snow white, and the Vegas roll are the top non shellfish rolls lol. The service is good. However, I had an experience here that prevents me from giving five stars. I  have on several occasions ordered the royal kamakazi roll and they would bring me back the kamakazi. The difference is deep fried, hence the word royal. When this happened the third time, the manager told me that the waiter who was making this mistake was new. He did not offer to exchange the roll. Considering that we eat there so much and have never had a complaint, I was disheartened that he responded with an excuse rather than fixing it.

I really like sushi from this restaurant. The service is great and the food is really fresh the servers are normally quick and their happy hour specials are some of the best in a Las Vegas if you want really good sushi here in Vegas give this place a shot.

This is me and my wife's favorite Sushi spot! The menu has an array of delicious choices, the staff is always friendly and attentive, and the price is very reasonable! I've taken at least two people here who were skeptical about eating sushi and both have converted to sushi lovers! Absolutely the best place in Las Vegas to get great sushi and have a very cool dining experience!

This isn't my usual sushi haunt but it's right up there tied for first place depending on what I'm in the mood for. The stuffed tomatoes (it's the name of a dish but doesn't actually involve tomatoes at all) are positively epic! The silky texture and fresh bright yet creamy flavor is borderline orgasmic. Service is good but the servers here tend to challenge orders which bothers me. I order something and get "are you sure you want that?" almost every time I've gone here. I'd love to try some of the salads on the all you can eat menu but I've been told the portions of the salads are big enough to be a meal on their own which is offputting because if I wanted just a salad and nothing else I wouldn't spend the money on all you can eat. The whole point of all you can eat, for me, is to try a variety of things. I've asked if I could just get a small portion because it's the same price either way with all you can eat but was told no. All you can eat sushi menus should be like Japanese dim sum, small portions big variety. This place has a huge variety but don't plan on trying much of it in a single sitting unless you're a competitive eater and be prepared to stand your ground when you ask for something like yum yum sauce on the squid instead of ponzu because they always seem to assume I'm a sushi virgin or something.
Amazing all you can eat sushi!!! Great service and they even have mouthwash in the bathroom (great for date night ;)

I've been to Daisho sushi twice, once when it first opened, and earlier this evening. It was ok. Their nigiri was good & fresh, and their green tea ice cream was yummy. The service was ok, and the rolls we ordered didn't have much flavor. Perhaps we ordered the wrong rolls... Since I live across the street I thought I would give it a try, but I'll keep going to my regular sushi spot for the same AYCE price.
Checked in after we ordered $50 of take out and didnt get my advertised free drink...

Ok I just love this sushi restaurant.  It's the neighborhoods best kept secret.  I've been coming here since it opened a couple of years ago and I always come back and bring friends and family.  Their sushi is always fresh and the prices rock.  There is always something on special.  The happy hour menu a little of everything awesome!  They have a all you can eat for $24.95 lunch and $26.95 for dinner desert included.  I've had the all you can eat here before and they keep the food flowing as fast as you can order it but remember like most places who offer all you can eat sushi they charge if you have a lot left over.  So order as much as you can eat but don't waist.   

I like a place that pays attention to customer service.  I don't think I've ever been in there when the one of the owners wasn't there. They keep a close eye on the business and it shows because the service is always good and the food is always consistent.  I can't say enough good about this local gem.  If you haven't checked them out you're missing out.

Their happy hour is the BOMB. Cheap beer, cheap rolls. A frugal fantasy! I usually do AYCE because I'm a very hungry piggy. Anyways, I love ordering Uni- but I am always skeptical when ordering it, because LOTS of places have old uni, which is brown and dull and tastes bad. Uni should be orange, slightly firm- not too firm though- as its a soft type of food, and its tastey when fresh. LUCKY ME- they had fresh Uni! Which is awesome! Because I've been let down soooo many times before at other restaraunts.

I particularly LOVE their shrimp bombs.
Also, they have no-rice sushi rolls, many of which are fantastic- Great for Diabetics.
Its also next to a neighborhood walmart- so if you need to get groceries after... you're in luck.


I have not used the bathrooms here- so no comment. But the restaraunt is very clean, and has nice decor. There are TV's around. Its a slightly small place- but it doesn't get too busy so thats just fine. Lunch is the best time, as its not crowded, and its nice an quiet-ish.

Food is about average.  I will give three star. But don't order pork belly and fresh tofu.

Service is not good. From coast to coast, this is the first place, waitress introduces us the RULE of ALL YOU CAN EAT, and not their sushi and drinks.
This is our neighborhood sushi joint and we love it! You have to get the Fantasy roll! Awesome lunch deals as well as happy hour every day!!

This is in my top 2 sushi places in town along with Gorilla sushi on the east side of town. The nigiri is off the charts tasty and delicious. The rolls are all good and the tempura and baked items are really nice. AYCE is the way to go and get your money's worth.

Ate here for mother's day 2017. By 1120am they were already full of customers, and they open at 11am.
Their portion sizes have definitely decreased but the prices are still very good however taste and presentation have gone to shit. Miso soup isn't flavorful anymore. Took an hour for them to bring a cali roll, cali crunch roll & cucumber avocado roll. They still have some of the friendliest staff in Las Vegas.
Will prolly return but not anytime soon.

Love the fact that these guys are only a block away from our house! 

Food is good too! 

I love the bacon wrapped enoki appetizer

And of course our typical favorites we always get at any sushi place...
Amaebi with the fried shrimp heads - MMM! Yummy! 
Uni - my husbands fave
Super White - so yummy and buttery tasting
Salmon - like what you're always use to so good
Surf Clam - always a must have

Rolls -

We'll be going back!
Food is very good here, the wife and I come here a lot. Great food, great service the price is fair, the people that work here is very friendly. I would give more then 5 stars if I can.

Very disappointed  in the way the owner is very money hungry his attitude towards his customers is always changing not very good customer service its sad! I mean after paying for 10 all u can eat to get one free what difference does it make ,Plus the quilty of the fish is getting bad the tuna with garlic had that white kinda nerves in it turned my stomach real sad when people just care on or about the money instead on how they treat there customers and the quilty of the food that's how a business goes under I won't be going back bye bye!   I'll be going back to sushi mon there the best by far!

So I was super excited i found a sushi place near my home. I hate takeout but figured "what the heck" how bad can it be. Waited for about 50 minutes for my takeout because they said they were busy but I only seen 7 people in the restaurant lol
The food was pretty good. I wasn't disappointed at all. But it looked crappy and they forgot my rice for my teriyaki beef bowl. Odd I know. I will eat here again just my Advice to not do TAKEOUT.

WHAT WAS THIS......

Ummm I have never really walked out on too many resteruants... but this was DEFINITELY one I could not stick around to continue.... =[ maybe it was a bad night... but one bad moment is a big turn off for me....

We weren't really greeted the server just kind of stared at us... then she came around & sat us... & was just a bit akward. No smile... no expression... no words really... she came around & got our order as we wanted to do AYCE.

Like the environment and the staff was very friendly. All you can eat sushi is delicious with a lot of variety. Bathrooms are clean and neat looking.

I love it here !

I saw daisho a couple weeks ago and was not very intrigued to go in . The neighboring buildings did not complement or compel me to eat sushi. Until one day (Friday) I was rather hungry and found myself driving to what ever caught my eye. And I saw that daisho had "regular rolls 50% off" and I do love my sushi and especially for 50% cheaper :) 

 At first viewing daisho from the exterior I did not find it very appealing . However when I walked it , I was presently surprised. It's interior is so pretty and the people were incredibly nice . 

I am writing this review for the 2 times I visited daisho and both times they met my expectations and exceeded it. 

The first time i got 4 regular rolls for $10 because it was BOGO free. They were okay but because I'm used to special rolls and haven't had a regular roll in ages .

The second time I went I went for the AYCE and OMG the choice in appetizers was ahhmaaazinng. ;) SERIOUSLY, your gonna give me salmon Kama? They also had skewers and I love bacon wrapped enoki mushroom however they did not cook it to my liking . And I was disappointed cause I was really looking forward to it. I'm scared of eating raw pork (because of my biology class). However everything else was really good ! I thought the food was about an 8 on a scale from 1-10 . But the thing that got me was definitely the service . I had jenny and Michael. Jenny was our server and she was so sweet and helpful. She was unfortunately the only server that night due to some mishaps she informed me about  but she still rushed to serve with a smile on her face . 

So if you want good AYCE sushi, and excellent service that's cheaper than other places daisho is for you !

My boyfriend and i came to daisno sushi for a date night. The waiter and waitress were very friendly and helpful. Food is super delicious, with sizable portions, and quick service. The staff is very friendly, even took the time to take a photo (multiple photos because I like lots of options) and knowledgable about the menu. Our date nights are always a success when we come here and it's always a lot of fun.

Daisho is a great place to go to for a spontaneous AYCE sushi craving... other than that, their sushi is ok. Nothing spectacular.. I do enjoy their blue crab nigiri, as they actually use real crab, rather than imitation. Sushi service is pretty slow, even if they're not at all busy.. but the servers are pretty nice. It's not their fault the kitchen produces the sushi slowly... I go back here because it is convenient since its close to my house, and the sushi isn't terrible.

My family and I usually go here every time we feel like eating sushi. I am a fan of Snow White roll, what's wrong roll, X-file and wild fire. baked green mussels and the pork belly. We loved the iron man, sex on the beach and Hulk roll too. I love the Daisho fried rice, I mix it with the miso soup. I think one of the reasons why we always go there is because the servers are great and the price of the food is reasonable.
Saw it near my office when it first open, been hooked ever since. The atmosphere is great and the staff is fun and friendly. Number one go to when I'm in the mood for some great sushi!

You know that unassuming place in your neighborhood that you constantly pass by and mentally bookmark to try sometime, someday? Well, that's what Daisho Sushi was for me. Located in the same plaza as Walmart Neighborhood, this little restaurant is great for a quick bite without the hassle of crowds. 

It was practically empty both times we stopped in during their lunch specials from 11-4p, so happy hour and dinner might be a completely different story. Daisho has 50% off rolls and drink specials during happy hour and an AYCE option, but I can only speak of their lunch.

For around $8, my teriyaki chicken combo included: miso soup, salad, steamed rice, 4 pieces of california roll, and shrimp+veggie tempura. Suffice it to say, you'll leave full with leftovers. Collectively, I was also able to try their baked mussels (first timer), tofu (nothing special), siomai (kind of small) as appetizers along with a sweet cold sake (strong for me), which is served in an ice bucket. 

Their digital artwork on the walls is pretty novel. A projector renders their centerpiece mural with movement and by the host stand, a marlin mount appears to be amongst waves... Overall, the service we received was fast and friendly. We'll be back to drop in again.

Awesome experience the owner Mike takes care of you and the sushi chefs and service is top notch! Good is excellent and fresh as you would expect.  I always try their uni and its fairly consistent and fresh as they could get every time.  They do sweet shrimp with a twist, uncooked shrimp meat with cooked head section that provides a balance of cooked and raw if that makes any sense.  Try the scallop nigiri and you wont be disappointed.
Great local sushi joint!  Inexpensive and good quality.  They do 50% of regular rolls most days that I've been there.  Very nice staff, too.  It's nice to go order 5-6 rolls and pay around $20.
Top Quality Sushi! Top Quality service!  All you can eat for 25 dollars that includes sushi, hot apps, chicken, beef, noodles and even dessert!  Great place. Enjoy!

Went here the other night with a friend for dinner since she was craving for some sushi. I had no idea this was in the same plaza as the Ohana Haiwaiian place! Anyways, the sushi rolls were pretty good (esp. the Daisho and Starfish). The nigiri was a hit or miss for me. Some of their fish was obviously not fresh while the others were pretty good. I would recommend getting the yuzu salmon and garlic tuna. The seared salmon was not even seared at all and the scallops didn't have much taste to it. I would not recommend the chicken and beef skewers at all. They were pretty tough to chew and it was weird because they didn't look natural (I'll post pictures so you can see what I mean). It looked like they just blended the meat together and just reformed it into one piece. They ran out of the enoki bacon so I didn't get to try that one. 

Anyways, this place is decent for an AYCE in the Henderson area. It's not the best, but not the worst. If you are in the area and are craving for some sushi, this place will get the job done, but if distance is not a factor, stick to places like Sushi Neko or Sushi Twister.

Daisho just recently opened?  I am not entirely sure but I have been their twice so far.  Each time it has been fantastic.  The food is really well made and delicious.  The hot food are really good, and they have many things on the menu that many other places do not have.  The sushi rolls are pretty good.  I think there was one that was a miss but everything else was very creative and well made.
My favorite and it's close to my house, perfect! I can have sushi anytime I want, sushi is good and they always have special price.
HAPPY HOUR NEVER DISAPPOINTS! Our go-to spot for a quick sushi fix. Our fave rolls are the Fantasy, Royal Kamikaze, Valley of Fire, and Casino Royale. Yummmmm!

I went here tonight with family & friends. At first everything about the place was pretty inviting. The restaurant itself wasn't super ghetto like a lot of American sushi places tend to be. I chose this place because I heard a Japanese person was the owner & hoped that the standards would be a little higher. I don't have high expectations when it comes to sushi in America & never expect it to be like Japanese sushi... I mean you can never expect a different country to get it 100% right. Americanized sushi in it's way has it's own charm, so I'm by no means one of those people who expects Japanese standards when in America. However it wasn't even the sushi that bugged me. The sushi was average. Didn't hate it didn't love it. 

The service is what really got me down. When we went there it wasn't that busy. There were actually a lot of workers. Two girls & a man who waited tables as well as worked in the back. 3 waiters for a not so busy sushi restaurant. So you can imagine our shock when we waved & "excused me"d in a none aggressive way over & over & over again & got no attention. It got to a point where I was waving from my seat, both hands up & everyone eating at the restaurant was looking at me like, "WTF" & STILL no one came. So basically 3 waiters are purposefully not serving us or they are all extremely bad at their job because the place is not that big. How can you not see me? The girls didn't have bad attitudes but I could not get over the fact that there were 3 of them, & I got the attention of all of the customers & still could not get a waiter. It made me feel even more sad when they all gave me dirty looks as if I was a bitch, even though I wasn't being aggressive & I was only trying to get someone to do their job & get my friend the beer they forgot to bring... I even got the attention of the man who was working there & he was wearing gloves so he made a hand signal at me saying that he could not help me. One of the girls was right next to him but he didn't even tell her to go help me, he just went to the back & went on with his business ignoring me completely.
It felt like someone had spit in my face, I was so insulted. It's funny because everyoneeeee was getting waited on except for us. Tables were being wiped & we still could not catch the eye of the waitress..... & okay I am not going to scream for someone to help me & throw a fit & make a scene.... so I just tried to be cool about it while entertaining a friend. 
 My guest was handicapped in a wheel chair. Maybe they were prejudiced against that?  I mean we went in there not demanding anything or needing any special treatment... we were just hungry wanting to order food! It was so bizarre how singled out we were! 

We were pretty cool about it & just had our conversations hoping that someone would stop by to see how we were doing, since politely trying to get their attention was out of the question. 

30 minutes later after the whole incident with the man the beer never came & we ran out of food. No one came to see how we were doing so we actually had to get out of our seat & walk to the sushi bar to ask someone to help us. At this point I really wanted to get out of this place but I was entertaining a guest who was visiting from out of town & could not just up & get out of this horrible place. I never got any refills of my drink that night. We never got asked if our table needed more food or drink. I mean I'm not even sure this is a restaurant really because I did not even have the opportunity to order more food. The worst part was after the guy who never got us any help was done with whatever he was doing in the back he was waiting tables again & would hover & hover & hover over our table but NEVER ask if we were doing okay or needed anything. I am really glad we decided not to get the all you can eat because I can imagine we would have payed a lot of money & never received any of the food.
Not only did I leave hungry & thirsty, I left feeling insulted & embarrassed. I had drawn unwanted & uncalled for attention to myself by people who were getting waited on. On top of that I had entertained a friend in this low grade place. This is the first time I've left a restaurant with my stomach still rumbling. Also I really doubt this place is owned by a Japanese person, that must have been a rumor. In our culture no matter what kind of place the restaurant is, we have a strong "hospitality" rule where good service is number one over anything. When I find out that an owner of a place is Japanese I find that the service is fairly decent. The race of the owner doesn't matter to me but I can't help but judge on that aspect if the rumors are true. Definitely not authentic at all. Maybe it was just bad luck but I can't help but feel like were singled out for whatever reason because it was just not busy enough for us to have had that level of service. I will never come back again & never recommend this place.

*This visit was just THREE days after Tony T.'s and Michael K.'s 5-star experience....

Before meeting up with the gang for some Bingo action at South Point, we decided to get our sushi on here after hearing that they had good nigiri, kick-ass appetizers, and that the head sushi chef was from Blue Ribbon inside the Cosmopolitan. Already with high expectations and an appetite for destruction, we sit up at the bar, go all-in with AYCE.

We start off with both the salmon and tuna poke. The salmon was good, but the texture of the tuna was kinda suspect...gave them the benefit of the doubt, and ordered up some nigiri- Uni, Blue Crab, Fatty Albacore, and Amaebi. "The Amaebi is not good...too small" says our sushi chef......OH....KAY??? "The tuna is good" he says...so we put our trust in him, and dig in.
