Uni is good, Blue Crab is sweet, but the tuna lacks its glistening fresh appearance and again, I'm hesitant, trying the Fatty Albacore which looks butchered and is barely cold, almost body temperature...I chase that bad feeling with my Iced Green Tea, then I ask where the tuna is from...his answer?  Hawaii...after tasting the mediocre tuna, I knew for a fact that it did not come from the 808 State and that this knock off sushi chef was playing me for a chump! I much rather have had that smaller Amaebi, but then again, who knows how fresh that was!?

Little did he know that he was messin' with The Goyemonstah......

Little did he know that the Goyemonstah was born and raised in Hawaii AND worked at a fishmarket with some of the best tuna from our own waters...

and VERY little did he know that The Goyemonstah wanted to reach over the display case and.....Never mind!

We ditched the nigiri section and ordered off the appetizer section-Miso Black Cod, Hamachi Kama, and a few Yakitori-Bacon Wrapped Quail Eggs, Bacon Wrapped Asparagus, and Bacon Wrapped Enoki Mushrooms. I expected Yakitori items and the grilled fish items to arrive on separate plates, but what we got was a pupu platter complete with orange slices delivered by the former Blue Ribbon sushi chef himself with everything on the same plate! The flavors from the Miso Black Cod and the
 "Ha-Ka"(Half of a Hamachi Kama, not to be confused with the war chant that the New Zealand All Blacks perform before they prepare to kill the opposing team) all blended with the Yakitori which was a big fail in presentation. They probably tested the other half of the Hamachi Kama for freshness? We ordered a some scallop, salmon, and saba nigiri, still just okay, and the cure on the saba was barely evident.

I order a Shark's Tale, Wild Fire, and What's Wrong? Roll. The Shark's Tale mentions tempura snow crab...it is tempura imitation krab. Wild Fire Roll was okay and the What's Wrong roll was swimming in sauce and was alright. I think our Yuzu Sherbet and Green Tea Ice Cream were sadly the highlights here. No half rolls allowed until your last order, and only one dessert per person FYI....

Shady quality of fish, lack of presentation and witnessing lots of shortcuts(they don't make their tamago, and soft shell crab is fried, chopped, and prepared way in advance-YUCK!) does not warrant a return visit here....ALOHA!!!

They took really long to make my food and messed up my order. It wasn't busy and the presentation was whack and I got food poisoning within 30 minutes of eating it /:

The server was very nice though.

This is our second time here and it was just as good as the first. Prices for all you can eat are great ($24.99 I think) and you get a lot of choices. Order half or whole rolls. They do it all. Their miso soup is awesome. Their garlic tuna is to excellent and has great flavor. Choices for desert are so so... fried bannana, bananna split, or the typical ice or mochi but I've been to other sushi places that only offer the typical Japanese deserts so this didn't bother me at all. 

Customer service both behind the bar and outside is fantastic. We never had to ask for refills as they were dine automatically and our empty plates never sat for more than 2 minutes. The sushi chefs are very friendly. They take time to talk to you and have a conversation while they make food. 

We will definitely keep coming here when we are in the area.

So I decided to make Daisho my last sushi spot before I cut back on AYCE sushi meals for awhile D': I've abused this whole all you can eat sushi privilege since I moved to Las Vegas a year ago and it's finally catch up on me. Le sigh.

Anyway, I decided to go with Daisho since it's the new buzzing spot on Yelp and I had to see what all the 5 stars were about. 

- Decor - 
To start off, the decor is mediocre. Nothing too special, but they have time to improve that later in the future and doesn't really affect my overall experience. The plates they provide are regular large circular ones you would normally find in any other restaurant that isn't serving sushi. Merh, I guess I'm just more used to the traditional small rectangular plates. 

- Nigiri - 
I can see why the majority of the ratings are 5 stars. The fish is the freshest I have tasted in awhile from the AYCE options. I feel like since sushi restaurants give you the option of eating as much as you can possibly can for a mere ~$25, they can serve not so high quality products. But I must say, the hotate (scallop) was delicious, and the uni was the best I have tasted in Vegas thus far. I've never had so much uni piled on one piece of nigiri. I was actually really shocked on the amount I was given. However, that was the only nigiri where I felt spoiled. Although the fish they serve were all fresh, the slices were really thin. HA! THAT'S WHERE THEY GET YOU! I knew it was too good to be true :( I guess you really can't have your cake and eat it too, oh what a world. 

- Rolls - 
Moving on to the rolls for those who don't care much for raw fish. Their rolls are surprisingly the biggest reason I'd come back again and again. AND I NEVER SAY THAT! So good news, they offer half order rolls, bad news is that you have to wait till your 2nd or 3rd round till they allow you that privilege. I love their 'no rice' rolls. Basically everything you would typically have in a roll except instead of being wrapped in seaweed it's wrapped in cucumber, and of course no rice. The one time I actually enjoy a roll, they put a restriction on it and say it's only one per person :( All the other rolls you are welcome to order as much as you like. They have a huge variety of rolls so if you're a roll lover, you've hit the jackpot. One thing I must make note of is that if your go-to roll is the spider roll... order the 'Godzilla Roll'. Their version of the Spider Roll incorporates lettuce (why??). The Godzilla roll is the usual Spider Roll you'd find at any other sushi restaurant. 

-Appetizers, other items-
Something I really enjoyed about Daisho that really sets it apart from other sushi places is their selection of appetizers. Quail egg wrapped bacon, asparagus wrapped bacon, and mushrooms wrapped bacon! I wasn't very fond of the "fresh" oysters since they were warm when they got to our table. There are many other items to make up for it though.

All around, not bad, not bad at all! I'll definitely be taking out-of-town friends here who are more into rolls than nigiri here.

I decided to come her for my birthday dinner and it was great! I came with two other friends to dine and right when we enter we were greeted and seated. Our server even tried to converse with us with I though was good compared to other sushi spots they don't really do that much. We went ahead and do the All You Can Eat one of the lowest price 24.95 dinner. Every thing was so on point and so good. We order a variety of dishes from garlic edamame, fresh oysters, oh and they have these skewers that you got to try! theyre basically bacon wrapped mushrooms, quail eggs and so far. The place was a good size and friendly staff would be back !

Customer service is awesome! Thy are so quick and everyone helps out! ACYE menu is awesome ! 

Baked muscles are awesome, so amazing! 

Love their sushi!

My husband and I were delighted to find this gem had finally opened! We've been anxiously waiting for what seemed like forever!!!  We've both been in the service industry for more then a decade and we were totally impressed from everything like the servers who were sweet and accommodating to the owner who not only introduced himself but engaged us in conversation even got our background and remembered our names when we came back the second time.  The sushi was great, but the attitude of the owner and his enthusiasm to make his establishment a success.  I don't see this much excitement and passion from someone very often in my business. It's so refreshing to see someone with that much passion about his dream. This will be our go to spot on date night from now on.  I look forward to tasting the next valley of fire or warm springs roll. Two of our favorites!  I urge anyone who reads this to take a chance on a great new neighborhood sushi restaurant that seems to put guest service and a desire to be a success first!
I love DAISHO! 
Welcome to the neighborhood! 

Tamara and Rick C

Came here for an impromptu dinner with my best friend & mother. It was Happy Hour, so the two "Chef's Special" rolls I ordered (the Paradise roll & the Casino Royal) were 50% off, which was cool. I also ordered garlic edamame & veggie tempura - both divine. Though the food was pretty good, the service was spotty. It took nearly 15 minutes to actually be served in an otherwise dead restaurant.

This place was not bad. Service was ok and a little rusty. Asked them about the Yelp deal that will give a free cocktail and since we don't drink Alcohol we asked if we can substitute for a soda and the waiter's response was "No". Not very nice about it and though could have been handled better. Some of the dishes were good but not very impressed with the rolls. They put too much rice on the rolls and the taste was more Americanized rather than more authentic Japanese food. Probably not going to go back to this place since there's other places better and closer to where we live.

Food was bland and the service was even worse. 45 min to get a roll never asked if we wanted more saki. Left pretty disappointed. I recommend the blue fin. Awesome service great food at the same price.

Was in the area and found some good reviews so I decided to pop in for a light dinner.   The bonus is that they have happy hour specials (half price sushi) and an all you can eat option.  

I ordered three rolls (rainbow, 007 and Dragon) to curb my appetite.  Overall I was expecting something much better than what I got.   It may have been the fact that the California part of the rolls was a salad mixture not the pieces as per the norm.   

The flavor was ok but it just didn't hit the mark for me.   I out that error on me because I probably took it for granted.   I did like the happy hour option so that was a bonus.   Next time I am in town I might find another option.

I had the salmon poke, miso black cod, and salmon hand roll, all of which were delicious! My favorite being the black cod. It is much cheaper than other places I've had it at too which is always a plus.

My bf had the tempura udon and spicy salmon hand roll. He said the hand roll had too much sauce and the udon/tempura was just okay... Seems like the sushi stuff is better at this place. 

I would definitely come back :)

Me and my sister went for lunch today.  We both ordered the lunch special of two Chef's choice rolls with salad and miso soup for only $15!  It was delicious!  I can't remember the names of the rolls though - I think Kamikaze was one of them.  Anyways, it was delicious!  The service was excellent.  I will be back and want to try the ramen next time for lunch.  Their menu of rolls is extensive!  I'll also be back with my hubby for the AYCE.  They have an X-File roll!  I have to try it!!

Overall a great experience  

I came here for an early dinner, the place was fairly empty. Looks like I made it before the dinner rush. Was greeted by the waitress right away and sat at the bar. I got the typical AYCE Vegas Sushi experience...which is a good thing...trust me the AYCE Sushi joints in this town have a winning formula down. Fast, efficient with a large diverse menu.

The staff here is fast, efficient and friendly. The menu is also large and diverse. I liked all the nigiri and rolls I ordered. The are a few dishes that I would skip the next time I come here. I didn't care for the batter on the Soft Shell Crab Tempura or the Fried Oysters. To me, they were off...not a a fan, too oily for me...light, but greasy, not light and crispy. I would also skip the Pork Belly and the Yellowtail Collar. I've eaten much better Pork Belly at Korean Restaurants or Shabu Shabu places, nothing stood about this one. The Yellowtail Collar is fine, its just a ton of white meat, felt like I was eating a fish steak, could be more tender and moist. 

I can definitely seem myself returning.

Solid food but I wouldn't necessarily say spectacular.  

We came early on a Saturday, and per AYCE rules, ate till we dropped.  The rolls were good and this spot is worth a visit.  Friendly and accommodating service.
Absolutely love this place!!! The owner is super nice and always remembers our favorite rolls when we come in.

This place was a favorite at one time for me. One weekend I went will a group of 4. Everything was good. I'd have to admit the 4 of us maxed out on the all you can eat.  Then I went back a week later this time there was 3 of us. This time there was one huge difference. The staff remembered us from the previous weekend. So our sushi was packed with double the rice. This made it a horrible experience all you could taste was the rice. We said something to the server that there was more rice than last time. She dismissed the claim but did admit to remembering my group. After she walked away she went to the other servers and spoke to them in japenese. Next we could tell they were talking about us. Also I notice the chef was staring at us. I'm 100 percent sure they doubled the rice portion so we wouldn't be able finish so they could charge us extra. That is a shady way to run all you can eat. I will never return.

We've been going to Daisho since they've open and always make our sushi meals be at Daisho. We love the atmosphere and the friendly staff/Owners who take the time to say hello. The food is delicious and the cost is typical for regular meals or all you can eat for sushi restaurants or even less.

Not bad but the fish portions are super stingy. It's hard to enjoy a meal when I feel like I'm getting cheated. It's too bad too because the service is above average and the atmosphere is pleasant. Some stuff is too warm and the cucumber salad is way too sweet. Unfortunately probably won't be back but it was worth a shot.
I love the crunchy roll and tiger roll and all their surimi and their sake is delicious .

I've been to Daisho about four times and have had no complaints to date. My last visit, I decided to do AYCE. I usually get my AYCE from Oyshi, and I'm even reconsidering switching to this place as my main joint. Daisho is slightly better and has a better price on it. I was surprised by the roll quality. It wasn't loaded with rice like most places, and the fish was flavorful and not bland. The service was exceptional. My waitress brought out a wrong dish once (the names were similar,) but she immediately brought my correct order out. The yakitori was phenomenal; I ordered it twice. Their nigiri, regular and special rolls, and appetizers were all to my liking, and I will definitely continue to come back!

Really great sushi with many no rice options and cucumber rolls as well as great rice rolls. Service is great and done as a group approach. 
Surprisingly really loved the cabbage salad !

Thumb up UP !!!.
?????? ??????????Jenny ^^
There are lot of sushi bar...but I like this place.  BCS I like mike and jenny. they are not JP but try to making better sushi and better place to be pleased everybody! . Hey !! Buddy.  Don't miss this place.  I LOVE DAISHO.
Love this place!  Tried it on a whim bcuz if Groupon and now we are hooked.  Amazing staff, great food. Highly recommend the yellowtail poki and the sunomono.  So delicious and unique.

Went in there sunday morning mothers day at 11a.....That place filled up in no time.  excellent food and service....I honestly dont know how they pulled it off with only the 2 chefs and some extras....take out orders all over the place...the chefs were justin and nelson, great guys, and again, excellent service....ps  order the mussels!!!

Just "okay," which is unfortunate since I really wanted to like this place after reading all the good reviews.

Nothing really "wowed" me on the menu. There is a good selection of rolls and non-sushi items, but the selection of nigiri is the same as other AYCE sushi restaurants. The quality was ok, nothing special, nothing terrible. Service was lack-luster even though we were sitting at the bar and the restaurant was less than half-full.

I guess it is a good addition to the east side, but it wouldn't be my first choice if I was driving this far for AYCE sushi.

I heard about this place through Groupon, & I'm so glad I did. 
We ate here on a Fri from 6-7 pm & we were seated right away.
Our server was very fast, attentive & friendly. 
The food also came out super fast. 
We ordered the daisho fried rice, beef yakisoba, shark's tale roll, gyoza (theirs is deep fried, not pan fried), & shrimp tempura. 
Everything was deeeeeeeelicious & good presentation too! 
The tempura sauce really stood out because it wasn't like the normal tempura sauce, it was a lot better - really flavorful.
The food portions were a good amount for the price.
They also have AYCE sushi.
Happy hour is from 3-6 pm and 9-11 pm. Half off chef's special rolls.
The lighting was nice & bright. I don't like dim restaurants where I can barely see the menu.
I live far from this place, but it is worth the drive, so I will be back!

This place earned the spot on my top 10 favorite local sushi restaurants here in Vegas for only $24.95 AYCE dinner this place have so much selections from appetizer to special sushi rolls. The portions are just right, they even let you do half rolls which most sushi restaurants won't. 

I recommend Wild fire sushi roll and starfish sushi roll on their chefs special. Also try the shrimp balls as appetizer it was so good. 
Fresh oysters was so delicious I wish it didn't have limit on how many you can order .

The only down part is the service. It took a really long time to get our orders in otherwise I would had given this place 5 stars.

Best garlic tuna I've ever had! Sushi here is always fresh and consistently good. Service has gotten much better from the first time I visited and now the wait staff are all pretty attentive and friendly. This is my new go-to sushi place because I don't usually  have to wait for a table. AYCE is a good deal @ $24.95 for dinner with quite a good selection of appetizers and dessert.
A-ok for ayce. No complaints. Nothing to rave about. A good choice to fill your belly.
Walked out after a couple hand rolls and micro pieces of nigiri. Uni was melting, meaning old. Don't waste your money here.

Went there on a Friday night for the AYCE. The inside is small but it doesn't feel cramped. There are so many roll options, much more than I've seen at other popular sushi places in Las Vegas, and it includes appetizers and a dessert. 

Awesome part was that there was no crowd, no waiting, and super fast service and of course everything was super delicious. 

So next time I want sushi instead of waiting an hour or something just to get a seat and then another 30 minutes before ever seeing food, I'm going to be coming here! By the time other people just sat down to eat I'll already be full, happy, and done.

I love this place! Their prices are very reasonable and their service is great! I never have problems when I come here. Their rolls are &4.50-6.50. I got the eel crunch, garlic tuna roll, and the shrimp tempura roll. So yummy! Their happy hours are 3-6 and 9-close. Their chef special rolls are half off.

Decent sushi and what you would expect from a place like this. All u can eat for 25$, pretty good deal. Didnt get 5 stars just because  it didnt seem like the freshest ive ever had and the service was prompt but not super friendly. Overall good experience and would come here again because it is close to my house.

My favorite sushi in the valley. Having the opportunity to come and sit at the bar is easily what made me fall in love! To be honest, don't come when they're busy, the servers and small counter make a large capacity hard for them... but come during the happy hour and you will never be disappointed! Especially if you like some delicious super white tune!
I came here for lunch and the sushi was good. Some of the rolls were soaking in sauce, though. Just say easy on the sauce as you order. Will be back to try the happy hour.

There is nothing better than a great low key sushi place that is right around the corner from your home. Daisho is definitely that place! 

We had some delicious rolls, and our customer service was beyond excellent! We went on a Monday around lunch time and we were literally the only two people in the entire place. 

We had some great rolls on demand and we had an all around great service. This will definitely be our new Sushi spot in Vegas!

Local sushi joint (like walking distance from my house) with an actually legitimate selection of nigiri. I'm not usually one for rolls, so I didn't check those out, but the list looked decent on the menu. 
Bonus: $25 ayce for dinner includes rolls, nigiri, soups, salads, etc. 
extra bonus: the grand opening is still going so it's half off all rolls

Love all the food we ordered. My favorite is the fresh oysters, muscles, the poke and the sashimi so yummy... Will for sure be back here when i crave sushi food. A happy Vdate for me, my daughter and my hubby. Happy Valentines day everyone.

I usually try to give a place more than one try but I don't think I will be back.  The few rolls we ordered were good- Wildfire, Las Vegas, Stuffed tomato. Everything else was just meh...the miso black cod was tiny, the bacon wrapped enoki was limp and the japanese lasagna was the worst I've ever seen, they wrapped it in foil and it literally fell apart when we tried to eat it.

The worst for me was the amaebi that I had to send back cause they were fishy smelling and looked all gray instead of pink and clear.  The fresh oysters were not so fresh either, their only saving grace was the uni, at least that was fresh.

Yeah- Daisho, I tried you and you failed me...on to the next one...

Very good sushi. . I am picky, but this place holds up. Very cool NYC vibe too. Late night half off is too good to not take advantage of. 

Great service, good place. I suggest it

Prompted by glowing recommendations from trusted friends, I finally made a return visit almost two years following my initial ROTD-earning write-up of Daisho Sushi. What I got was an enjoyable AYCE sushi meal that hadn't diminished in quality much if at all.

I'd been due to eat sushi with one of my pals for a while, and I convinced him to try this place instead of the usual "Mon" restaurants. We were planning a lunchtime meal, and Daisho still allows you to pay for the $25.95 AYCE dinner at any time of the day if you want to get access to special menu items (many of which are one-per-person).

I forgot to ask about whether they still offer fresh wasabi, which is a highlight at my favorite place. Oops.

An additional page has been added to the AYCE menu recently, and this one has various extra tapas/appetizers, some sashimi (one-per-person, dinner only), and some special rolls. My friends had cautioned me to steer clear of the pork belly and the sizzling beef, so I can't report on those. The takoyaki was surprisingly good, with a crispy exterior, tender interior, plentiful bonito flakes, and tasty sauce. The biggest drawback is that the actual tako (octopus) is a pretty small piece.

I also enjoyed the soft shell crab tempura (definitely use the sauce), the yuzu chili salmon "salad" (basically a sashimi), and the sashimi portions of super white tuna and yellowtail w/ jalapeño, but the portion sizes (e.g. nigiri cuts instead of true sashimi) were quite modest considering that these were all one-per-person. The relatively worst item was the ika butter (squid cooked in a sauce), which was a little chewy and forgettable flavor-wise. Lastly, the Iron Man roll (super white inside, tuna on top) was good and still quite palatable at the end of a huge meal.

The appetizers on the classic menu were just as good as before. Bacon enoki was my lone yakitori order. The bacon was meaty and smoky, though still lacking crunchiness, and the enoki was soft yet still has that snap. Miso black cod was still great, although I've tasted a better version of it and therefore don't think the world of this one. The yellowtail collar had meaty portions and fattier, more tender bits. Plus, after one past negative kama experience, "not burnt" is a positive. The fresh oysters were on the small side, but they were really good. The fried oysters were similarly small, which is unfortunate because it's linked to the fresh oysters as one-per-person. Lastly, the baked green mussels were cooked properly and not overly sauced.

Nigiri is still the sushi mainstay, and Daisho delivered for the most part. I loved the flavorful blue crab. The uni was as good as you expect to get in the AYCE quality range, and the amaebi was nice in spite of being a little mushy. Scallop (the good stuff, not bay scallop), yellowtail, and salmon were tasty. The fatty albacore wasn't flavorful, and the default wasabi sauce didn't help. The biggest letdown of the meal was the super white. I realized after ordering the super white tuna salad (a new, one-per-person menu item) and the super white nigiri that (1) they sauce all of their super white with this slightly spicy condiment, and (2) the quality of the super white itself is significantly worse than what other local places offer.

Dessert is one item per person. I won't dock them for what is unfortunately a common policy among these restaurants, but it's always enjoyable to have more dessert. I chose the fried banana this time, and I'm wondering now why I didn't order it in the first place. It's like the banana split in that it's topped with so-called vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, and sprinkles, but the banana pieces are fried and give a richness and a warm temperature contrast. Just like last time, I happened to have some leftover bacon to throw on top of this. Just like last time, I enjoyed it. Best AYCE sushi menu hack ever.

It was not very crowded at 1:30-ish, and they provided the expected quick service. The first round of items came out in quick succession from the chefs/kitchen after they'd handled the few other tables' orders, and other rounds seemed to arrive faster. Empty plates were quickly removed too. The only issue was that the server didn't seem to understand that we were ordering for each other or for "the table," so to speak. For example, when we tried to order sashimi for the first and only time, she stopped us and told us that it was one per person. We had to start over and have me call for super white, and him call for the yellowtail. No biggie, but something to be aware of.

Along with the other minor food blemishes, the super white deficiency is why I've decided that I can only give four stars to what's otherwise a solid AYCE sushi restaurant. If you've been to a favorite AYCE sushi place too often and need to change it up, or if you want dinner variety at lunch hours, Daisho remains as good as any secondary options.

First off... Rude jokes, secondly... The appetizers we ordered were ice cold, third... I ordered a cup of hot water with lemon and the server brings a plastic cup of hot water (straw included), fourth strike was that no refills were offered. Finally they refused to split our check in four ways cause it's "not allowed"!! The manager gave serious attitude after we explained how we were going to pay when he said we could only use two cards. Apparently cards means check. I will not be going there again.

Very poor service! The fish isn't very good and the service is TERRIBLE. Absolutely terrible!  It took over an hour to get three rolls. There are so many options for AYCE, so avoid this place and go somewhere else.

So far I've been here once and had their udon to go before. The udon is good and you get more stuff with it than just the soup and noodles. Today I got all you can eat and their fish is good! And they have my fave! Surf clam! It's so hard for me to find it at a good place.  It's a clean establishment (: I'm  happy. The only thing that sucked was that no one paid attention to me for about 20 mins. And I was alone so that made it feel worse :(
This is now my favorite sushi place in town. I suggest Daisho because it is close and has good food!
Omg, I loved it. Food is great, service excellent, friendly staff, even during their rush hours. We made it into a biweekly girls date. Highly recommended it.

Great food, fresh and yummy! We have been several times and always quality rolls. The Wildfire Roll is our favorite but there are so many to choose from. Tonight we tried the Dragon and Tiger as well and all were great. The Happy Hour is half off many of their rolls which is a real value. We will be back Daisho!

This is a very quiet lunch place for great Ramen with the best soft egg in town.
The fried rice was also good.
The menu is extensive so we will have to come back often.

My boyfriend and I stopped by here because the AYCE ended at 4 21.95 not bad. But honestly the service was so bad! My boyfriend ordered the Death Valley roll and he would come to our table and say " it's on the way" after he brought my volcano roll he says " oh I forgot about yours " we were so upset. Not worth it at all. Plus every time we ordered the ones that DID make it to the table it would take over 20 min. Keep in mind there is a 60 min eating limit. Save your time. Go to Sakana!
This is a great sushi place.  If you like sushi you must try the Uni, yellowtail and the Paradise roll. This place is so good and fresh.  Uni shooters too

Have visited two times and really enjoy everything! 
The location is great and not busy. 
The food always tastes great
The prices are decent right now with their grand opening 
The staff has always been great but I think they should talk to their guests more. In comparison to other sushi places, if they worked on this they'd get a 5 star!

Went here with my boyfriend and his family and there was a good 10 of us. We appreciated how the restaurant accommodated us. However, the service wasn't great as they kept messing our orders. They got all the rolls mixed up and almost didn't bring us some. The waitress seemed very confused. 

We got a lot of the regular rolls because they were 50% off. I would've gotten AYCE but there was too many of us and not everyone wanted it. I ordered the spicy crab, spicy spider, garlic albacore, Alaskan, and eel rolls, and shrimp and crab tempura appetizers with my boyfriend. The rolls were VERY tiny. My favorite flavors were the garlic albacore and Alaskan, the others were very plain. I was really disappointed with the spicy spider. It wasn't spicy and it had lettuce in it which was odd and something I've never heard of before. It messed with the flavor.

I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with my visit! We went to Daisho on a whim since its very close to the house and we will definitely put this on our local sushi rotation. They had some interesting rolls and the interior was cute and modern. Staff was attentive and helpful. Will be back!
Service was ok, Johnny roll was decent. Other roll was white fish deep fried. They drowned it in soy sauce so it was soggy. Overall it was MEH. I will go the extra few miles to Musashi on flamingo.

Didnt like Diashon Sushi. Terrible! Treated my Son to the ACE. Can't tell u if the sushi was good. Every bite I took, FROZE my teeth! Tuna, very "low grade". Enjoy the $56.00 u got,  u will NEVER get another dime from me.

I have been coming here religiously for over a year and they never cease to amaze me. From their delicious sushi, to their great customer service. In my opinion best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas with standard AYCE sushi prices. We always eat more than our money's worth here at daisho.
Another amazing lunch here! We love this place so friendly and food is great! $9.95 Sashimi Lunch Platter is perfect for my mid-week sushi craving!

Let's start by saying I don't even eat sushi but I love this place. The reason I love this place is because my wife loves this place and that works for me. They are always super nice and she loves the food. Said its one of her favorite places to get this stuff. So anything that makes her happy makes me happy. Thanks ! The happy hour is a great deal and you should check it out.
I used to go all the time even if the service was bad. At least the food was good. Today I had to walk out this place... dirty floor , dirty tables and waiter with attitude. Just not for me!

Note to self: five rolls of sushi are too many.

Thanks to their grand opening special where regular rolls are 50% off, I find myself sitting here super full--much fuller than I expected anyway. It sounds like the special pricing will be ending any day now. Still, their regular rolls are very reasonably priced (from $4.50 to $6.50).

I (over)ordered the Alaskan, Eel, Salmon Skin, Spicy Scallop, and Spicy Yellowtail rolls. I didn't care so much for the Spicy Scallop and Spicy Yellowtail, but the rest was good. The simplest and cheapest turned out to be my favorite (the Alaskan, consisting of salmon and avocado).

I'm happy that we finally have a nearby sushi place for lunch again. $20 AYCE for lunch is a good price. I just don't have that kind of time. I'm eyeing their lunch specials menu for next time.

This was the best meal i had in Vegas. Get the Godzilla roll! Only caveat is if you go all you can eat, you get charged for anything that isn't eaten. Luckily i had finished with a cheap roll so it wasn't bad. Just keep in mind and start with the expensive rolls and work towards the cheaper rolls and nigiri. The salmon collar was also delicious!

This place is not far from my house and I've now been here about 4 times. Each experience has been good, the food is fresh & tasty. One thing I would like to highlight though is that recently they started serving Ramen & WOW is it delicious. My Ramen came with a perfectly cooked piece of pork belly, an amazing broth that was rich & satisfying and an egg that was cooked to perfection & when opened the yolk oozed out into the hot soup.  The noodles in the Ramen were good, pretty much took a back seat to the broth and pork belly flavors.  I hope they keep this dish because it's outstanding & I'll be going back soon for more.

I basically live here. The food is amazing. The phoenix roll and what's wrong roll are to die for. Reasonably priced and such a friendly loving staff. And you must try the ice cream. The best in town. And I mean real ice cream with the chunk of ice you Knossos what I am talking about.
my and my pop's go-to ayce in vegas. staff always attentive, food, fish is quality. would def. recommend if your hungry for sushi.

I come here all the time! Their happy hour can't be beat! And their all you can eat is my personal Disneyland! Always love everything I order, and somehow their red snapper is fresher than what I used to get in California! This place is incredible!

The food was pretty bland and nothing really stood out. The service was REALLY slow, despite there only being 4 seated tables and the servers were not  friendly at all. It wasn't terrible, but there are waaaaaaay better places to go here in Vegas.

I just decided to try Daisho Sushi after driving by it to go to another sushi place for months. I go for the AYCE for lunch.  Been there three times in the last six weeks. The choices on the AYCE are extensive. The food has always been good and the service has been great.  I really like the Japanese Lasagna.

I love this place...i literally order take out from there practically every other day because of their great grand opening prices (50% off regular rolls!!) I hope they continue that special for a long while because they will definitely continue to see me...I've dined in a couple of times and choose to sit at the sushi bar because I've received great service each time & the chefs always make good conversation, the owner is always there and is so friendly, he always makes his rounds around the place and tries to greet all the customers, he personally introduced me to their new happy hour deals which is also great (half off all specialty rolls), their spicy ahi roll recipe changed since they first opened and is a little more spicy and i personally prefer their old one better, but I've had quality food on each visit and will continue to frequent the place

Best sushi I've had in Vegas. Had the blue crab, uni, sweet raw shrimp, hotate, hawaiian ahi seaweed poke etc etc. Etc. Love this place. My new fave because it's hidden in a strip mall and not at all busy. Once it's discovered it won't last too long though. My kids (teens and young adults) absolutely loved it too....just awesome

Been here a good amount of times with the boyfriend.

Let me just say it's different when it's just a romantic date and a night out with friends. 

We come once a week to see our favorite server. 

When we came this past Friday, yes I'm aware it's a Friday in lent and a lot of people come to this place for a meat free meal. We came right after the rush and our server just seemed so tired or something. I mean she did mention her last table was 24 guests!!! 

We usually get too notch service when it's just the two of us but as a group it was a bit of a longer wait. 

I wouldn't wait 45 minutes for it again. My friends were just insisting we stay because it was a lot of food. 

I did notice though after about 30 minutes of waiting, our server asked us all if we wanted soup or salad while we waited. 
In that time we had already seen 3 other guests that arrived after us already chowin down!!

So we ended up waiting and had shoved our faces with delicious food right after the server dropped it off. 


Like I said, it's much better when it's just 2 on a romantic date!

We will be back in a few weeks. Just think we need a little break for now.
Our favorite AYCE in Vegas. We come here as often as we can. Love the food and the staff.

All you can eat for $20 lunch and $25 dinner. You order off the menu, they make it and bring it out to you. The waiter was awesome, sushi was good and instead of paying $300 on the strip, we Ubered and spent $100. Next visit to Vegas, we'll be back!!
Great place good portions of sushi and always fresh plus open til 11pm every night so 5stars from me :)

Came here when they first opened and thought they'd do well. Now they are very busy, glad I was right.

Service is fast, the food is great, lots of choices, and generous portions. The lunch boxes are awesome! This is my traditional after-nails treat.

The only suggestions I have are to turn down the AC - it's always frigid in here. Also, you never see them again after you're served, so you have to flag someone down for a drink refill. They're still quick and courteous, just not proactive.

Definitely a solid 4 stars for Daisho Sushi!!! 
We usually don't venture out to this side of town but after seeing so many delicious pictures posted by @aznttboy on my Instagram feed, we had to come check it out! 
Came on a Saturday morning so we pretty much had the whole place to ourselves..
Nice clean & open space. They are located in the same plaza as Walmart-neighborhood. 

My boyfriend went with the lunch AYCE while I paid a couple bucks extra and went with the dinner price.. I wanted to sample all the special 1per person/dinner only items..
-Oysters / were good!
-Yellowtail Poki / came on a bed of seaweed salad and was very good! You can also get tuna or salmon poki..
-Miso Cod / buttery and sweet! watch out for the bones though!
-Yakitori Skewers / we got bacon wrapped asparagus, enoki mushrooms, quail eggs & the tuna... These things are huge.. 2 sticks come in 1 order so don't order too much! Bacon anything is delicious although I would have liked the bacon to be a little bit more crisp.
-Nigiri / Everything was decently fresh and we didn't run into anything horrible but the standouts for me were the scallops and fatty albacore! mmmmmM
-Wild Fire Roll / (no rice) spicy tuna, tuna, albacore & soy paper.. Loved the presentation! 
-Miso Soup / seemed a bit watered down & they don't offer the option to add the shrimp head to it.
-Dessert / we had the standard green tea ice cream & yuzu sorbet.. hopefully they add some more creative desserts to the menu!

Service was fast from our server although sometimes it seemed there was a language barrier but he was very efficient. The sushi chef who helped us was nice and kept the conversation going and the food a-flowing.. Forgot his name but he likes to play golf and he is from S. Carolina LOL

HOT TIP: Ask for a stamp card!!!! 
Watching what you eat? No problem, they have like 6 non rice rolls + several fish only appetizer items.

Service was great! Good food and affordable all you can eat $25 not bad for dinner. They also offer bento dinner or lunch box if the ACE menu is a little too much. They have plenty of selections also. I really like their salmon here ,it's cooked just right. The restaurant is also by eastern and warm spring by the Wendy's shopping center.

This place is a solid 2.5 so I have to be fair and round it up to a 3 star...

a.  Location - 5 star - On the southwest corner of Warm Springs and Eastern, very accessible from most parts of the valley. For us, it was a 10 minute easy drive from Henderson.

b.  Ambiance - 2 Star - A bit spartan in terms of feel and decor, however, that is cool. I would say the music was both loud and obnoxious.  Not sure how / why you would want your clients to dine in loud punkish modern music that is neither food for the soul or nurturing.  It was also loud enough that it nearly impeded conversation.

c.  Service - 2 Star - We got here at 6:00 and ordered two Bento type dishes and two AYCE sushi which comprised of about 5-6 choices.  Took about 50 minutes to get the first sushi after the two that had the Bento type boxes had theirs for about 15 minutes. I find that rather odd.  Also, when I asked for hot Green Tea, I was advised that they did not have green tea, but another kind.  I asked....is it Genmaicha and she came back with the little sweet tea bag that said genmaicha.  Well, I think I am a bit stuffy tea drinker because I like this type of tea in it's real form, a whopping two teaspoons of loose roasted rice and barley and tea leaves in a pot to steep and all the flavors of this very tasty tea.  Coming out of a tea bag..... nah.

d.  Food - 2 star - besides getting to us so late, here is the dealio:

- Bento Box with Teriyaki Beef - The beef was so dry and thin and overcooked and over sauced, it tasted like Costco Teriyaki Beef Jerky dipped in soy sauce. Wow. Both over powering and salty.

- Amaebi - This is a special dish I love because of the fresh raw shrimp and then the fried shrimp heads.  Where were the fried shrimp heads?  Come on, you cannot serve this dish half axx.  This is totally a boo hoo disappointing disaster.

- Maguro - I love to have Maguro Nigiri Sushi with a thin slice of lemon and thin slice of jalepeno. It really makes the taste perfect.  When you serve this with a SPAM size chunk of lemon and jalepeno, it actually over powers the Maguro and well, nigiri is all about complimentary and simple flavors, so this was a complete miss.  I had to remove all the lemon slices and jalepeno to make the maguro edible.

- Miso Cod, Hamachi Collar, Star Fish, Daisho Roll, Wild Fire, Mexican,   All the rolls were edible and uninspired. It did not help that they serve these sushi on huge American size platters instead of smaller plates that match. It was hard to fit plates onto our table, and it was very unappetizing.

e.  Overall - 2 star - really?  Food was barely adequate. Not prepared properly, Japanese is all about presentation and the food was poorly presented.  I was really shocked because after reading the review s I was raving to go celebrate my BD at this place and instead, I felt more like I compromised.   Worst part is that the place was empty for about 40 minutes and service was poor, then it was packed as so many groups came in, I had to go from shy asian boy to obnoxiously loud demanding diner boy and keep pushing for service, food and the bill...

I was shocked!  DAISHO in japanese means big victory or soaring large.  This place needs to change its name to something else....

GK says, OK, I was a year older and depressed.  Go check this place out.  I will come here again and give it a second chance. It was all me the first time........ Fried Shrimp Heads, here I come...

I wouldn't come to this place pass 10, they don't want your business. Sometimes I wonder what places expect to do during their last hour of business. Do you want to make money? Or is it your clean up time? If so then change your hours because I believe you should service a customer fully if they are in your restaurant in time. But hey, that's just me.

Sushi places are a dime a dozen. You could literally eat at a new place once a week and who knows when you'll try them all. The sushi here is okay. Not bad, but not amazing. They don't offer anything original to them. I went here for convenience but I don't like feeling like an inconvenience.
Excellent experience last night. Over food quality was fantastic. Service was efficient no problems would highly recommend!

Food was really pretty good! Loved the California Roll Crunch and for the price the Chicken Bento box is a big value and was delicious! Our waiters switched in the middle of our meal. Our waters were empty almost the whole time and they didn't come back to check on us. There was like 4 or 5 waiters standing around talking in the very quiet restaurant. The food came out quick, fresh and hot. More people started walking in around 7:30. I would definitely recommend this place for their food (maybe take out) but not as the experience as a whole. The atmosphere is pretty cool though with a projector of a Japanese village across the entire back wall. Don't know if we'll come back.

Japanese cuisine is one of my faves! This place is okay, I like the endless choices available for those who want the All You Can Eat option, and the friendly staff.  However, the many many many dishes we tried were a bit flat...only a few tickled our taste buds. Our favorites here: Kimichi Tuna, Shrimp Bomb, Fried Oysters, Poke, Sex on the Beach, Shrimp Tempura, and the Udon. Yes...we opted for the All You Can Eat Dinner for lunch, came in on empty stomach, and tried to try everything on the menu (we did not even accomplish half!

The sushi is great. Love so many of the rolls and the all you can eat has good quality fish. The service is pretty good they're friendly and is usually pretty fast. All that being said absolutely do not sit at the sushi bar. The sushi makers don't  even say hello to you when you sit down they don't even ask you for your order.  you have to interrupt them and give them your order and they give you a nasty look and act as if your inconvenient to them. And doing all you can eat every time you need something you have to wave them down and they barely acknowledge you if you order something. They're not friendly. And this was not just a one-time thing we go here once a week and the few times we've sat at the bar have been awful they're just so rude and unfriendly. I will continue to go here and sit at a table because the food is good and I like the location but I don't recommend sitting at The sushi bar
This place was ok. The food was like any other sushi place. The only thing that bothered me is the table was sticky and sometimes the servers forgot things.

Best kept secret for sushi at lunch!  Parking is easy they have the TVs on and service is very fast.  Everything that we have tried there has been freshly prepared and delicious.  Prices are good and the even have all you can eat for both lunch and dinner.  Beer is served ice cold.

This was my first time here. I had the Philadelphia roll and a California roll. The rice was very good and the sushi tasted very fresh. Service was wonderful. The only complaint would be that the rolls were very small. I don't know if this is standard or because they have a grand opening special with 50 percent off their rolls. That is only reason I deducted one star UPDATE: we went back for lunch again. This time we had a crunch shrimp roll and a California crunch roll. They were both seemed a lot bigger. Especially the California crunch roll. Very good and at such good prices!

I wish the service was half as good as the food. First, they gave my child a cup of juice with a hole in it. When I asked him to take back the cup, he didn't even return with extra napkins to help clean up, I had to go to the bathroom. To make matters worse, my husband was done eating his meal before they even caught the fish for my first roll. There were two people at the bar and us. I saw 3 chefs and 3 servers while I was here. Unfortunate because the sushi is good here.
Best sushi in town!Always fresh,service is great,the people are very attentive,became our favorite restaurant!

Another AYCE sushi joint in Vegas??  

The reason why I am giving them 5 stars :

Yakitori is GREAT.  Asparagus, Enoki, Quail Egg...all great!  Great sauce, great cooking consistency...yummy!

The Apps...some great ones here.  The Ahi Poke was plentiful and fresh, Oysters were smooth and also fresh tasting, Sake Kama was delicious and cooked perfectly (unlike the Hamachi Kama).  Nice to change it up a little besides just the run of the mill sushi.

The ROLLS.  I don't usually eat rolls...I am more of a nigiri guy myself.  But the few rolls I tried actually impressed me!  They aren't completely drenched in heavy sauces, and have lots of flavor!  The ones I enjoyed most :

Starfish : Yellowtail Tempura, Tuna, Daikon, Ponzu, and Wasabi Oil. Delicious!! Best "roll" I had here, especially since there is no rice!  I'd order this every time I am here!

Wild Fire : Spicy Tuna, Chopped Albacore, and Garlic Sauce. This was pretty good...lots of fish in each bite.

What's Wrong Roll : Shrimp Tempura, Soft Shell Crab, Masago, Rainbow Fish, and Screaming Orgasm Sauce. I liked this roll as well...the soft shell crab adds a nice taste and consistency.

Overall, the nigiri was also fresh and tasty.  I enjoyed the Uni here, Salmon Belly, Garlic Ahi, and Hotate.  Good cuts!

Finish off with some Plum Ice Cream! I enjoyed this much more than the Yuzu...good stuff!  They also made us some bacon ice cream...good!

Very clean restaurant, and the servers and staff were very fast, efficient and friendly.  

Pics :
Best sushi place I've been to in Vegas so far besides sushi Mon and goyemon. Service is great and fish is so fresh

I only tried a California roll once, at another sushi restaurant years ago, and today I had a sudden urge to try it again. I ordered take-out and everything was fast and easy. 

I didn't know until I got home, how much I actually ordered! I had 8 Cali Rolls and 8 Garlic Albacore rolls. I wasn't unhappy at all, because the price was amazing for all of that!! Only 8 bucks!? Everything tasted fresh and the flavors mixed so well together. I cannot wait to try more!

I'm completely happy with my ayce sushi dinner.. I was surprise with the freshness and flavor. The numbers of choices are amazing. I am not trying to boost their reputation but I  do want to give an honest review of my experience. I am very happy with everything that I ate. And the service was great too. Please understand that I do go to other ayce sushi places like "Yama Sushi and Sakana Sushi ". So I do know what I'm saying and comparing it to. Come and enjoy!

Love the place. Try to stop at least once every 2-3 weeks. AYCA is a must if you love sushi. Fresh made to order love it. They have a roll called sunrise - I think it should called sunset :) after eating that roll with the sauce I just want to go to sleep for the after noon. 
Their bento set is also great not too little and not too much.

Very disappointed and will never come back. This place was one of my favorite places to go until today. I like to go because children eat free with their parents. Today they told me that I'd have to pay half price ($13) for my daughter if she were to share with me, whom is only 30lbs. This was very misleading as the previous times I never had to pay for her and no where on the menus or displays does it say they charge depending on age. The all you can eat menu even says that children can share with all you can eat parents. She's 5 years old but because she's so small she eats just as much as a 2 year old. I ended up ordering her a full plate of yakisoba (this was the cheaper choice) for $7 which she barely put a dent in. We took nearly the whole thing home. When I spoke to the manager, he said that it was a normal thing and they have always charged. He said they always charge based on age because children eat at varying levels. I told him to look at her and look at how much she ate (or didn't) and he continued to argue with me. After arguing back and forth I thanked him for his time and told him I will never be back but he didn't care. He really needs to clarify this, fix the menu, and most of all fix his customer service skills! I should be reporting this to Channel 8, Consumer Reports, and/or BBB!

Food was really good. Customer service was great. Very clean. I will definitely go back. 


I got ayce and it $26. The also dont rush you and dont halt your orders.
From a flavor perspective, you cannot really find a better ayce spot.  Must haves are hamachi kama, black cod, lychee sorbet, garlic tuna and amaebi...
Absolutely delicious!  One of, if not my favorite sushi place in town. Always great service both at the bar and table. Must try the casino royal roll.

AYCE Lunch is not worth it. I know alot of AYCE sushi places have "rules" but their rules makes me not want to come back. One of them being that we can't order half rolls until (as the waitress said) "the end when you're too full for full rolls"... umm... what??
We had the all you can eat...can't go wrong!  Sushi was great!  The garlic ahi was phenom! Highly recommended!

We went here with a group of Yelpers. Honestly, I was having second thoughts about this place since the reviews seem inconsistent but with Tony T's guidance, we seem to have picked the right stuff from the menu. There were a few hiccups so I can't give this place shining 5 stars.

I tried the miso black cod, bacon-wrapped enoki, bacon-wrapped quail eggs, bacon-wrapped asparagus, yakitori beef, salmon poke, tuna poke, oysters, salmon skin handroll, uni, unagi, salmon, garlic tuna, amaebi, salmon collar, hamachi collar, Wild Fire, spicy tuna cracker, Starfish, fried bananas, red bean ice cream and yuzu ice cream.

5/5:
I love bacon so obviously the clear winners for me were the bacon-wrapped quail eggs, asparagus and enoki mushrooms. Also, 5-star worthy items like oysters, salmon nigiri (super good!), Wild Fire (tuna, spicy tuna, soy paper, chopped albacore in garlic sauce. NO RICE) and Starfish (yellowtail tempura, daikon, scallion, tuna in ponzu and wasabi oil. NO RICE). Yuzu ice cream - I haven't been to an AYCE sushi restaurant that serves yuzu ice cream.

4/5:
Salmon poke, tuna poke, garlic tuna, miso black cod (reminds me of Shiro's in Seattle), amaebi, salmon collar, spicy tuna cracker, fried bananas (get it with vanilla ice cream and well-rendered bacon topping) and salmon skin handroll (crispy skin).

3/5:
Yakitori beef, uni (was a little bit watery), unagi. Hamachi collar was charred on the outside but undercooked on the inside. I was craving for some shrimp tempura. Melvin ordered it but it didn't look so promising and he said it was just ok so I didn't bother ordering it.

They give you real plates instead of the usual sushi plate and they'll give you a clean one if your plate gets really messy. The chef/owner kept checking on us and gave us beer on the house. After ordering 6-7 hamachi collars and 6-7 salmon collars, the restaurant smelled like smoke they had to keep the door open.

The service was great but I'm not sure if it's because we were with Tony or if it's because we're Yelpers or if it's because that's just the way they treat all their customers. I would have to come back again to figure that out...eventhough this is far from home, I wouldn't mind coming back here. $20 for lunch (11am-4pm) and $25 for dinner (4pm-close) and the food is pretty good. And no, they don't have pork belly.

First off, I really loved the sushi here. The variety was pretty good. I also really liked how attentive the staff were, always asking how our party was doing and such. My second point would be how well set up the place was, I love the little fish tank by the bar. 

However, I know I will not be returning, only for the 1 reason that made the experience horrible. There is 1 apparent regular that pushed the limits of being loud and obnoxious. He sat at the bar verbally bashing just about everyone and everything in the place during his drunken stupor. The staff seemed to enjoy him being there and appeared to like him so I quietly finished and left, but clearly the workers here like being called slackers and librarians, so it's all good.

 I would definitely recommend the food, but won't return to the environment myself.

Now eight months later I have gone back several times and the food is as good as the first time. I would recommend if your hungry for sushi this is the place to eat sushi. There is hundreds of places in Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas and Summerlin to eat sushi and without a doubt this is a must go place, nice staff and fresh fish is a perfect combination for a great sushi experience if you don't go to Daisho Sushi you are missing out.

Decent food bad service. Waitress seemed to be in a bad mood. I won't be too negative but there was definitely a bad vibe and a very unwelcoming atmosphere about this restaurant. The dessert menu was limited but that's to be expected of a sushi restaurant.

I discovered this place is the closest ayce sushi restaurant to my work. They also open at 11 which is convenient when most other sushi places in the area don't open until 11:30. There is a wonderful sushi chef here that used to work at Oyshi on Sahara. He is amazing in his own right and can pump out some amazing signature creations catered to your taste. I ventured here with a coworker and chowed down on some rolls and nigiri. She ordered a few of the fried appetizers and enjoyed them all. The nigiri was fresh and the specials were surprising for a lunch menu price. The sharks tale roll was tasty. The salmon and hamachi nigiri were so fresh we ordered multiples. We will definitely be back for more lunch excursions as the prompt service and quick ordering makes for plenty of time to waddle back into the office within a decent amount of time.
Cheap, what more can you ask for? Tastes just fine fresh and I get like 6-7 rolls and seaweed salad for 12-15 bucks! Boom! Try it

Came here for the first time to try it out because it was recommended by a friend. The rolls are all nicely presented but the majority of the rolls I did not like or a lot of them were very similar we went for the all you can eat sushi for lunch and it was ok. The best part was the strawberry mochi for dessert.

maybe the worst sushi i have ever had. the sushi at smiths is way better and the sushi at smiths sucks. we decided to go for the 50% off happy hour special, but the joke was on us because when they say 50% off they mean the size of the rolls. they rolls are pencil dick thin.' at first i was trying to figure out how they could make them so small...they are a bit bigger than a nickel but not quite as big around as a quarter...the sushi chef here must really pride himself on the ability to cheat the customer.  I can not for the life of me figure out how this place has a good rating on yelp. if you love sushi stay away from this place.

I probably didn't give this business a fair shake the first time around. I'll attribute it to being a rookie Yelper that wrote a snap review because my gullet couldn't be fed at a fast enough pace. Since I thought the sushi was good the first time, I should have stopped back again before I wrote my review to see if they would show their true colors, and they have. I have returned 6 times over the last year and the service has been significantly better.

There seems to be stability in the employee turnover as we have had the same servers on the last three visits. Everyone is more attentive and the waits to order more food are pretty much non existent. The kitchen seems to always be on the slow side, but the sushi chefs have consistently been more efficient compared to my initial visit.

In the last year, the actual menus have been replaced, but the content is pretty much the same. Keep an eye on the specials board because they'll occasionally throw something different into the mix, like blue fin tuna or jellyfish. More recently, I've been sticking to just the apps and nigiri, so I can't comment on the roll situation.

Sometimes the uni has me raising an eyebrow, but I think their sushi is just fine for AYCE level, and good enough to make return trips for $26 a pop when I'm in the area. The menu also has plenty of non sushi items which will keep my wife and daughter happy. Good job Daisho, we'll see you next time.

Been waiting for a close sushi spot and this does the trick. Great prices & friendly staff. My only complaint is Ive been there 3 times and ordered the fried calamari but they dont have it. Not sure whats up with that. I will definitely go back and keep bugging them about it.

Daisho ranks as top 2 AYCE sushi in Vegas for me (my other fave is sushi koma). Fish is just as fresh as the other places. What makes it top 2?

- check in on yelp for a free cocktail
- AYCE poke bowls - tuna, salmon, or hamachi!
- banana split dessert!
- loyalty punch card

We have gone here about 5 times now and it's our new favorite sushi place. They have good prices, great sushi, good service,  no wait, and we're always very comfy there :)  I love the paradise roll!  The fish is very fresh too.

Good value for the money. While the dish was definitely not the best I ever had, for the price it was good. Waitress is attentive - we did the all you can eat and there were no long wait times for the waitress to come and bring more items - I have been to other all you can eat before Rhett they kinda just stop coming by at some point. I don't think i would go out of my way to come back just because I prefer places where I order a la carte and maybe with a little better sushi grade, but again - I was impressed with the place. It was definitely worth around $20 for the lunch (this would cover one special roll and a miso soup at other places).

I ended up coming here when I was driving around looking for somewhere to go for lunch. They have a awesome lunch special where you can get 2 specialty rolls for like 13 or $14. It comes with a miso and salad too. The sushi was really good, and I think it was a great deal.
Friendly service and good sushi! One of my regular spots.

Great atmosphere, food, and service. I've been here a few times and  the staff has been super friendly and upbeat. And clean bathrooms.+ 
*Avatar roll & Green tea ice cream are my favorites.

***i did not eat the sushi*** 

My friend choose this spot for lunch & I am not a huge sushi eater so I got the chicken yakisoba. ($7)

It came with exactly 5 small bites of chicken.  The noodles tasted old like they had been cooked the day before or they were not cooked for long enough. 

The sauce had a strange tanginess and was not very good. 

The service was attentive and it was busier for lunch but slowed down very quickly. 

My friend loves their sushi which came with a salad at lunch and all together our bill was $18 so it's a very cheap place to eat...But the last thing I want to eat is cheap sushi. 

Unfortunately I won't be back to try anything else out.
This is one my favorite places to go for sushi! You can tell they have quality fish here with lots of flavor. They have a big selection for all you can eat also very friendly staff.

They really skim you on fish and rolls are either filled with just crab mix or some nickel  sized tiny prices of fish. Very disappointed. I posted a photo of rainbow roll with just a little piece of fish on top and a scallop roll with almost nothing but rice. Went here for lunch $20. All the good items on the menu that actually have fish in them and are not full of fillers are only available on the dinner AYCE menu $25. However, after seeing what they put in regular rolls I doubt there is much in them either. They have a 50% off regular rolls promo but there is nothing in them except rice and a flavor of some fish. Too many other good sushi places around here to ever come back here....

Just had the all you can eat lunch here which was $20. The fish and rice tasted fresh. Service was friendly, and efficient, not over bearing which was a nice change of pace for sushi. You know sometimes I just don't want to chit chat, I just want my kamikaze roll and Asahi. I also really like the sauces they use and the rice balls are not too big with the sashimi. All in all an excellent experience.

It's ok if you need that quick fix, but I could not eat here regularly.  For the price of AYCE I could easily eat my normal order at my favorite sushi place.  

Atmosphere reminded me of sports bar with people yelling at he TV while sitting at the bar, and the seating was painful.  Hint... don't sit on the bench side (ouch).  Fried Banana dessert tasted frozen and mochi was also not right.

This place try's very hard, but falls short.  Buy 1 get one 1 Sake comes in smaller than usual bottles.

Wow this place is amazing. Went here on a whim after my husband found on yelp when we were on this side of town, and honestly way blew my mind.  Service was excellent. Sushi was fresh and there were tons of options.  None of our sushi was over-sauces which I think is common in this town.  They have an amazing happy hour menu that is very robust in offering from 3-6pm. They also have an all you can eat option - which we didn't try but the couple at the table next to us did and said they come regularly and love it.  Super kid friendly too.  Highly recommend.

I just tried Daisho today and I was impressed. My boyfriend and I had the AYCE dinner for 24.95 each. The quality of fish was pretty good. The owner actually was making our rolls because we sat at the bar and he is a sushi chef at his own restaurant. I thought that was pretty cool. The wildfire? Roll was fantastic along with the tempura snow crab. The friend  banana for dessert is so tasty! The menu was great. I felt like the nigiri menu had more items on it then most other sushi places. There were a couple of orders that we had to make multiple times before we actually got it. That is the only negative thing, but it can happen anywhere. I'll definitely be returning to Daisho.

This place is pretty bomb. Never been here before it's hard to find a good solid sushi spot with a awesome happy hour and the presentation of the food is really nice. Definitely will be back! The gyozas the yellowtail and the chicken yakisoba for the win!

Yelpers take heed. Maybe this place was good at one point but there are better places for you to get your sushi on.

Getting our car serviced near by and yelped Daisho as the closest and highest reviews in the general area and took a shot. Went for the lunch $21.95 all you can eat and wow, talk about taking you for a ride. Guys I know it's all you can eat but really way too much rice to fill you up..the proportions are just greedy. Not only that but the fish wasn't fresh, especially the mackerel (which for those who eat it, it's naturally fishy already) was brown and old looking/tasting. If it's not fresh, why serve it. Sorry to go back to the rice, it also was undercooked, had some crunchy pieces that were dry. Hate that. 

Service was lackluster. They don't even say hello and goodbye when you leave as in traditional Japanese restaurants. It's funny my wife said even how they walked look like they were dragging their feet. 

We complained, paid $70 for two adults and a child, and left hungry because we didn't want to order just to order. 

It's sad because the place looks like it would be a good neighborhood sushi joint, but look elsewhere...NO DAISHO FOR ME.

MY LOCAL GO-TO sushi spot!!!! My roommates and I frequent this place. Sometimes for their mid afternoon/evening happy hour or late night happy hour and sometimes for their all-you-can-eat sushi. Small, casual, and intimate atmosphere. Food is delicious and service is quick and attentive. Really just can't go wrong here!

As a family we usually go for sushi night at least ones a month. Tonight we figured we would try something new & we came here. We were seated & all was good until our waitress came. She was very rude about explaining how their 50% off on special rolls. My daughter only wanted an order of California Roll & she insisted we get two roll since it was 50% off but we told her no, she only wants 1 order of it but she still continued to say "you should order two and just take it home is she doesn't finish" and again we said "no". We go on with our order and she brings back a teriyaki crab roll & California roll. I told her we didn't order the teriyaki & she took it back with an attitude. They didn't much of a good option for dessert either. Restroom door was very hard to open especially for a child. We definitely will not be going back.
Excellent sushi and sides. Ordered age tofu(great sauce) paradise roll (cream cheese salmon coconut flakes yummy sauce) edamame (garlic sauce) and salad with ginger dressing.

The sushi is so fresh here we like the dragon roll and the Phillycrunch have not tried everything on the menu yet but what we have  we like so far parking is very easy at this place and the atmosphere is really good
Great sushi rolls, soup, salad, and experience. A solid sushi option for those Vegas vacationers!

Daisho Sushi is a moderate drive away from me (located in a large strip mall on the corner of S. Eastern and E. Warm Springs), but after making my way across town to try out their Dinner AYCE sushi, I am definitely a fan and considered the drive here well worth the effort for good food.

As the restaurant is still relatively new, they were not all that busy tonight (plus it was raining, and you know who people here shy away from driving under such precipitous conditions). So after being seated at the sushi bar, it was pretty much just me and Michael K here at the ~70 seats capacity sushi restaurant giving their menu a taste drive.

We started off with the usual limited to one per person orders: 
Uni, Sweet Shrimp and Blue Crab nigiri, they were good.  

We also gravitated towards their APPITIZERS section, and had ordered:
* Salmon Collar (the salmon was so tasty and naturally fatty, it was amazing, like having "Kobe" salmon) and Yellowtail Collar (cooked just right and I really enjoyed it with and without the accompanied ponzu dipping sauce)

* Yaki-tori (skewers): Bacon wrapped Enoki Mushroom, Bacon wrapped Quail eggs, Bacon wrapped Asparagus.  At other restaurants you can order just skewers, paired with responsible consumption of beer and sake and call a great night out.  I really enjoyed these.

* Shrimp Bomb (it is like the Jalapeno popper with shrimp and crab, but without the jalapeno).

* Miso Black Cod - tasty!  Insane in the membrane that this is in the AYCE line up!!!

* Tuna Poki - the poki are prepared to order, not something that was made hours ago and left marinating in the cooler.

* Yellowtail Poki

SPECIAL ROLLS:
* Star Fish (No Rice) made with Yellowtail Tempura, Daikon and wrapped in Tuna, finished with Wasabi Oil, Ponzu and Scallion.  (Recommended)

* Johny Roll (No Rice) made with Crab Meat, Shrimp Tempura wrapped in thin strip of cucumber and finished with Spicy Yum Sauce.

* Wild Fire Roll (No Rice) consist of Tuna, Spicy Tuna wrapped in Soy Paper, topped with Albacore and finished with Garlic Sauce.

* What's Wrong Roll (recommended by Chef Michael) made with Shrimp Tempura, Soft Shell Crab, Green Onions, Masago, Spicy Yum Sauce, topped with assorted fish and finished with Screaming Orgasm Sauce.

I could totally put away more food, but I have an appearance to make at Bacchanal the next day and thought I take it easy and just finished the meal with some Fried Banana with Ice Cream (it was a nice finish to the meal, but nothing that blows me away).

Totally satisfied and very impressed with the food we were served tonight.  There seems to be a handful of new sushi restaurants opening in Las Vegas recently, and most have had positive reviews thus far. So if the other freshmen sushi restaurants are as good as Daisho Sushi (which I now easily considered in my top 3 Las Vegas AYCE sushi restaurant list), the rest of the old guards will have good competition to keep everyone on their toes.  That is good news for all the diners out there.

Note:  Aside from AYCE sushi, Daisho also offers a la carte items for lunch and dinner in addition to their lunch and dinner specials.  And dinner starts from 4pm until closing.  Pricing are very competitive for AYCE (especially lunch, which does not seem to have a reduction in the selections available).

About the Chef: (kernels of knowledge gleamed from small talk during our meal)
Chef Michael is from New York. His parents own a Japanese Ramen, Yaki-tori (Japanese skewers) and Sushi restaurant there.  So even before moving out to Las Vegas and working as one of the sushi chefs at Blue Ribbon Sushi (inside The Cosmopolitan), he was already familiar with the competitive restaurant business. So finally opening Daisho Sushi here in Las Vegas, just seems like the natural path of progression for this passionate young chef in a new city he now calls home.  (Haha, I sound like his autobiographer).


5 stars!  But as words spread and more and more people learn about Daisho Sushi, and the restaurant undoubtedly gets busier, I hope they can keep up with the projected increased interest in their restaurant and the food they serve.  Good luck Daisho Sushi!!!  And I will definitely be back and bringing friends to tryout the amazing food I had earlier tonight.
Worst customer service ever! Staff was rude and non welcoming! Sushi is okay they just need nicer people working there!

I tried once again to place an order with Daisho. I ordered a lunch special from their menu online for $8.95 but they tell me my total is $12.95!! I told her that their menu says $8.95 so $4.00 in tax makes no sense. She says "oh, those prices changed a long time ago". So they don't care that their menus are nearly a year outdated and their prices increased by 50%! With business sense like this, it is only a matter of time before their business is shut down!

I have eaten at Daisho a few times for it's happy hour. It's average at best, but during happy hour the rolls are extremely cheap! My apartment complex is right next door and that's the other reason my girlfriend and I eat here.

For AYCE you can find better. Take advantage of the happy hour if anything

I have to admit, I wasn't particularly adventurous with my ordering when I ate here last week. We arrived around 12:30 and the place was pretty busy. They are still offering their regular rolls for 50% off so I got a few off the menu to try. My dining companion ordered the lunch special, which was also a pretty good deal. 

The fish was all pretty fresh and the rolls were made well. I would have given them 4 stars if service was a bit better. I know they were a little busy, but drinks went unfilled and our food came out slow. Their AYCE prices were reasonable and I have a Groupon burning a hole in my pocket, so I will be back. Looking forward to trying more items off the menu. Both the sushi and cooked items look enticing.
Love daisho. This is our go to sushi place. Cheapest sushi I know of in town with their regular rolls always half off if you buy two rolls and good quality sushi as well! Staff is very friendly too.

I have been to this restaurant a few times. I love the quality of the sushi, but the employees suck. I only gave this review four stars because of how good the food is. The workers aren't rude, they just don't provide great customer service.

Dropped in last minute to join some friends and decided on the AYCE because we wanted to "share" what we were individually ordering. Nothing was really spectacular, aside from the baked mussels & the salmon skin hand roll. Service was good, and quick. However, my friend ordered fried bananas at last call only to find out ten minutes later the oil had been turned off and they weren't able to fry it. The manager was nice enough to come over and aplogize about it, which we appreciated. All in all a pleasant experience, but not enough to win over my go to spots.
